story:
Introducing the Quel, the new generation In-Home-Display - Smart meter ready, Smart home ready... basically, Smart and ready!

Just for clarity - This product is beeing built and is due to be deployed to some major utilities shortly - this is your opportunity to receive it early, at a super-low cost and help us maximise its future capabilities -  if you contribute to receive one, you will receive one, irrespective of goals.

It's also our opportunity to showcase it - we're kind of proud of it

A brief history.

Current Cost has a reputation for delivering products to a large audience, since our birth back in 2006 we've delivered over 2.5 million products - our ambitions are even bigger with the Quel.

 

 

 

 

 

 

We've long since realised that there are some truly great products out there, sadly, they won't ever all use the same protocol - that makes the decision of what to use, pretty tricky - Throw into the mix the new generation displays for Smart metering  and you run the risk of having a wonder wall of monitors  ..............until now -

Pictured: First printed plastic design

We have an agnostic approach to communication, we all know some are better than others and some work in different environments better - but hey, we're not here selling comms' we're here to ensure you can use them... all

We are now manufacturing the first batch of Quels, these are for early trials with Utilities, but we want a wider user audience to try them, enjoy them and maybe give us feedback, they are fully functioning and C2 enabled, they will support:

Zigbee (SEP & HA) -Z-Wave -Wireless M-Bus -P1 & P2 -KNX -3G/GPRS -Wavenis -Bluetooth - 433 & 868 MHz -LAN

Every day the Quel looks for updates (via inbuilt Wi-Fi) and pushes these out to you, this will mean your access device is always evolving and ready for new technologies, it'll perform new functions and give you a choice of user interfaces - afterall, we're not all the same.

Because it has Wi-Fi it's already enabled for uploading information back to cloud or web based services.

Due to the software platform it's built on, the Quel can integrate existing third party apps - This is great news - mainly because it saves us doing it, but also, some of them are really rather good!

 

 

We want to bring all that good and smart stuff together, in one place, easier to manage, control, view and manipulate. This ensures your Quel will never be redundant or stranded with older technologies - You'll only ever need a new one when we offer a choice of colour!

 

The present choice of 'smart stuff' includes, but certainly isn't limited to:

  • Energy Monitoring
  • Metering, smart and pre-smart
  • Usage alerts (water, gas, Electric)
  • Individual appliance monitoring or control
  • Scheduled events or balance control
  • Lighting monitor, control and dimming
  • Thermostats and environment control
  • Temperature/humidity/Smoke/Gas Detectors
  • Security
  • Door locks
  • Boiler maintenance
  • Occupancy sensors
  • Radiator Valves
  • Motion sensors
  • Assisted living

... the list goes on

                                     Pictured - early frame design

 

                                     

As is, this beautiful little device with a 7" screen will retail at £99.00, that's fully inclusive of a C2 receiver - which works with the following. 

There's a growing range of C2 Transmitters, for connection by CT, plugs, circuits, some gas meters, some water meters and even some electric meters.

 

Although there's a good deal more C2 sensor types being built, there are hundreds of third party ones that will integrate with the Quel right now - any cloud services will drop straight in, all common RF will plug in - the list of services grows on a daily basis

 

 

The access panels on the back allow different protocols to be plugged in easily - ensuring if you change your system or there's yet another new protocol, you can adopt it. Above shows a non-standard LAN version.

Built in, is a detector to ensure the screen is only on when you need it - no point in wasting energy!

Instruction manuals and videos are in-built to the device, that's a few less trees destroyed at least.

The Quel will work in Landscape or Portrait, although most early artwork is Landscape, we can push Portrait as and when it's available, we think choice is important.

The whole concept of Smart could get diluted or remain partially un-adopted if we don't start bringing it all together - The Quel offers that chance, a static device for all the family to use and engage with - where occupancy, well being, security and energy can all sit together in one neat bundle

And.....

If we don't ship, you get your money back - simple as that.

 27th August - This mornings pushed update - looks like we have a couple more icons!



Spread the word... let's make it happen.

We'll add some FAQ's just as soon as they are asked (even if they're not frequent).

If you have any ideas for the product, any comments, see any missing (realistic) perks 

- or make contact for any other reason - indiegogo@currentcost.com

 

 

The full Quel range for 2014

The Pre-Quel, is an entry level device designed for utilities

The C-Quel has been designed as a full consumer access device, that includes some specialist features for utilities.

 

The My-Quel however is your Quel (and there are not many more like it)

story:
Thank you for stopping by this page.  My name is DaMarcus Morton and I have partnered with the Los Angeles Youth Network here in Los Angeles.  This program is near to my heart because as a youth counselor, I know the potential a young person can reach if they are given just a little opportunity.  Every dime you donate helps keep the doors open to teach, mentor, support and love these youth.  My grandmother raised me volunteering and giving back.  We didn't have much to give, but we gave anyway.  July 6 when she was buried, the city of Akron declared that day Hazel Morton day.  I pride myself on living in service to others as my grandmother did but it takes a village.  Just a small donation means a great deal to me, but the world to them.   

1. LAYN has four facilities providing a complete continuum of care from Emergency Shelter to Independent Living Programs.

2. More than 350 youth will spend at least one night at LAYN this year.

3. LAYN offers services for youth aged 12-22 and a full host of educational, enrichment, counseling, and aftercare services.

4. By the end of the year LAYN will provide its youth with 2912 hours of paid internships both within the organization and in the community.

5. LAYN has an outreach team working during the day, evening, and weekends to locate homeless youth and connect them with the services they need most.

6. LAYN has extensive case management services to ensure that youth are able to get the services they need and will not have to return to the street.

7. LAYN offers mentors, psychotherapy, and tutoring to inspire youth, provide role-models, and the support they need to succeed.

8. LAYN believes strongly in education and enrolls all youth in school within three days of their entrance in the program.

9. More than 80% of the youth who enter our programs do not go back to life on the streets.

10. LAYN is governed by a Board of Directors committed to financial stability, efficiency and transparency. More than 80% of your donation goes directly to program costs.

YOU CAN CLICK THE WEBSITE LINK BELOW FOR EVEN MORE INFORMATION.  I THANK YOU FROM THE BOTTOM OF MY HEART FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
Saving Lives with New Farming Practices 

My name is Abay Kennedy and I grew up in Ethiopia. As a child, I observed the devastating impact of droughts and famine on my family, community, and homeland. Even though I currently reside in the United States, Ethiopia is never far from my mind. Bringing modern irrigation techniques to my homeland is a heartfelt and passionate endeavor. If you can make a contribution to this project, I will be personally grateful.

In the hot, arid climate of Ethiopia, farming is highly dependent on the wet season in order to grow sufficient food for both people and livestock for the entire year. The goal of the Abay Agricultural Project (AAP) is to bring modern dry farming to the area. This will allow us to increase crop production three to four times by relying upon irrigation and more drought resistant crops as opposed to cultivating traditional crops in the rainy season. This approach drastically increases farming efficiency and minimizes the potential for famines, which have long plagued this region.

Gibe River will be used for irrigation              Drought damaged corn crops 

What is Dry Farming? 

Dry farming is farming with techniques to compensate for a lack of natural rainfall. These techniques include the use of irrigation to bring in water from some other source and the growing of more drought resistant crops. The use of water-pump generators and other irrigation equipment, allows water to be pumped either from some body of water or an underground aquifer. This method reduces reliance upon rainfall which is often unpredictable in both time and amount. Irrigation places the control of agricultural water in the farmer’s hands rather than leaving him at the mercy of nature.

 Dry farming methods eliminate reliance on seasonal rain and increas food out put

 AAP’s Project

AAP has purchased about 1000 acres of land located near the Gibe River, one of the largest rivers in Ethiopia. The Gibe which flows year round is a very reliable source of water. The funding request is for $50,000 to purchase a water-pump generator and other irrigation equipment. This equipment will allow AAP to implement modern farming practices instead of relying upon traditional farming methods, which have often led to insufficient food production and famine.

 In addition to dry farming, AAP plans to introduce drought-resistant crops including wheat, barley, corn, cotton, and safflower.

AAP currently grows and raises a number of crops during the rainy season, some for experiumental purposes only, which includes :

• Food Crops - Corn, Wheat, Teff, Millet & Sorghum

• Pulse Crops - Soya Beans, Haricot Beans, Horse Beans, Chickpeas, Lentils & Field Peas

 • Vegetables Crops - Garlic, Onions, Tomatoes, Lettuce & Green  Peppers 

• Commercial Livestock Production 

 Purpose

The purpose of this project is to increase food production in a poor drought ridden country. AAP proposes to do this by the implementation of modern dry farming techniques. This will substantially improve life for many people in this famine prone area in both the immediate future as well as for many years to come. If this conversion to dry farming and other modern practices proves successful, then we predict that this approach will spread to other farms, communities, and countries in Africa.

While Ethiopian soil creates a fertile growing environment, much of the land’s potential is untapped. Traditionally, Ethiopian crops are only grown once a year in the rainy season. The rest of the year, the land is idle as sustenance crop production halts. Some regions of the country are too arid to successfully produce even one crop. When droughts occur, the rainy season becomes even shorter and this contributes to famine.  

The dry season follows the harvest of the wet season and the land becomes idle. The land dries out and consists of brown, dusty, and lifeless soil. Land, farmers, and plows are inactive for the next six to seven months. There is a lack of rain to sustain sufficient crops. Without growth of vegetation, food supplies become scarce. Livestock production is also hurt with overgrazing and shortages of feed. 

Now is the time for AAP’s creative dry farming and drought-resistant farming ideas to be implemented on a large scale. AAP has already experimented with these techniques began by hiring local farmers to cultivate about 300 acres of land. These farmers successfully employed irrigation and planted drought resistant crops to produce sustainable food, year round!

AAP is also educating farmers about improved seed varieties and agricultural practices. These farmers will serve as role models who will help whole communities improve the yields from their harvests. If we get full funding, this project is expected to be completed by mid-2014.

The two major benefits of this campaign are job creation and the sustainable year round production of food. Job creation is important because it becomes a “force multiplier” for the other positive benefits of the campaign. People with good jobs not only are able to support themselves and their families but they help support various other local businesses and the employees of those businesses through their purchase of goods and services. More people with jobs mean a better more prosperous community.

This campaign will create jobs in three types of ways. First when the Abay Agricultural Project is in fully operational it will have positions for 10 permanent full time employees, with the possibility of more in any future expansion. Second AAP will be requiring between 50 and 100 seasonal employees for work on planting and harvests. Finally, in the long term this project will create other jobs in the community as other farmers come in and copy our methods and approach. Students from local schools will also be coming in to learn and eventually copy what we are doing when they get involved in farming themselves.

Having three to four harvests per year instead of only one will protect the area from the famines that have plagued it for so many years. In additoin the production of surplus food will contribute substantially to the economic development of the region. These benefits will go to the people directly rather than being filtered through government bureacracies and officials, as is the case with many foreign aid programs. People will learn to help themselves rather than being dependent on handouts from other countries or the government. 

Funding

I hope that you strongly consider funding this worthwhile project to allow us to:

  • Purchase irrigation water-pump generators, Portable & Stationary

  • fund sprinklers,  pipes, valves & accessories

  • Cover expenses for professional services for equpiment installation and R&D on drought resistant crops

  • Cover overhead expenses

If we don't get full funding for our project, we will use the money we have received for the rental of irrigation equipment to be used for the implementation of as much of the project as possibile.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please Spread the word...

Share, talk to others, call, text, email, Facebook, Tweet, and...forward this Indiegogo link to everyone you know and especially to individuals who wants to make a difference in the world and believe in creative idea. We have 60 days to raise $50,000 through Indiegogo,  so PLEASE HELP ME ROCK IT to at least $50,000 and beyond!!!

Check out the fantastic Perks as well.

International shippment cost more, so for $50 and $100 funders if you are outside of USA, we need your help to cover $10 more shipping cost.

Thank You!

I like to to give a big thank you to lonepeakproduction company specially, Bob, Paul and Jermy for help me with my video.

story:
In order for SPIARC to function as a nonprofit in our neighborhood, they are required to have a fiscal sponsor. A few days ago we found out that SPIARC is going to be losing their fiscal sponsor as of the New Year.  Without a fiscal sponsor, SPIARC will no longer have access to their grant money; thus, they will lose the building and the community could lose the important services found therein. 

After discussing the situation, we came to the conclusion that the SPIARC building was too valuable to the community to lose, and we decided to put Anagnorisis in the running to be the new fiscal sponsor of the SPIARC building.  There were two requirements for the new fiscal sponsors that have been expressed to us:

·  They want the new fiscal sponsor to be local people that are willing to invest in South Park.

·  They new fiscal sponsor needs to have a 501(c)3 with the government.

The first requirement is no problem; however, if we are to meet the second requirement, we are going to need some help. 

We are already recognized by the state of Washington as a nonprofit; however, getting recognized as an official 501(c)3 through the government is a much more tedious and expensive process – especially if you need it to happen quickly.  Filing all the paperwork is going to be $900 alone, combine that with the money we would need to get our website off the ground, and we are looking at a grand total of $1250.  If you feel like you would want to help us reach our goal, please donate - anything helps. 

(A special thanks to Chuck and Holly Anderson for already helping with our logo and design so our future website will look nice and professional!).

story:
Global Village Kids

We are a non-profit organization based in Portland, ME dedicated to the care and aid of children and other vulnerable groups in Cambodia. We have worked to open schools and keep children safe from exploitation, in addition to general community support efforts.

Elder Sight Restoration Project

Since spring 2012, we have been able to focus on caring for elders, by providing access to cataract surgery, restoring their sight and independence. With their sight restored, these elders are no longer totally dependent on their children and grandchildren. Without the responsibility to provide total care to their elders, the children are now able to attend school.

With our purchase of a large van, we are able to transport 18-20 patients at a time from the Prey Veng area to Battambang Ophthalmic Care Center (BOCC), where SEVA trained doctors perform surgery.

Your contributions to this campaign help us to provide transportation (the van is already paid for, but gasoline and drivers are continued expenses), food and lodging for our patients while they are away from home. Each patient will make the trip from home to BOCC twice, once for each eye to be operated on. About one quarter will require a third trip due to infection.

For spring 2013, we already have 60 candidates for surgery lined up. That's three vanloads of patients, requiring 2-3 visits for each group. Word of our program has spread due to last year's success, and our waiting list is long. With successful fundraising, we hope to bring 100 people for treatment this year.

Contact Us, and Share Our Campaign

http://globalvillage-kids.org/index.html

http://www.facebook.com/GlobalVillageKids
story_txt:
Global Village Kids
We are a non-profit organization based in Portland, ME dedicated to the care and aid of children and other vulnerable groups in Cambodia. We have worked to open schools and keep children safe from exploitation, in addition to general community support efforts.
Elder Sight Restoration Project
Since spring 2012, we have been able to focus on caring for elders, by providing access to cataract surgery, restoring their sight and independence. With their sight restored, these elders are no longer totally dependent on their children and grandchildren. Without the responsibility to provide total care to their elders, the children are now able to attend school.
With our purchase of a large van, we are able to transport 18-20 patients at a time from the Prey Veng area to Battambang Ophthalmic Care Center (BOCC), where SEVA trained doctors perform surgery.
Your contributions to this campaign help us to provide transportation (the van is already paid for, but gasoline and drivers are continued expenses), food and lodging for our patients while they are away from home. Each patient will make the trip from home to BOCC twice, once for each eye to be operated on. About one quarter will require a third trip due to infection.
For spring 2013, we already have 60 candidates for surgery lined up. That's three vanloads of patients, requiring 2-3 visits for each group. Word of our program has spread due to last year's success, and our waiting list is long. With successful fundraising, we hope to bring 100 people for treatment this year.
Contact Us, and Share Our Campaign
http://globalvillage-kids.org/index.html
http://www.facebook.com/GlobalVillageKids

story:
I am Buddyfolks and many of you may know me from my work in the community and as a member of the musical family Maximum Sound The Band.I am also an air shifter/DJ on community radio as well as an Urban Farmer that teaches the youth the importance of urban farming, sustainable agriculture and living. In doing much of that work along with the work it takes to provide for myself and family I have acquired two hernia's one on each side and they have now grown to a point to where herbal methods are not an option. I must have surgery done to repair this issue and get me to the point where I am able to do the works that I do with full strength. At the moment my medical issue limits my movements and is overdue for repair. My health is important to not only me, it is important to my family, and community.  It is time I give myself that same love and attention so I can be 100% for those that depend on me for support. Your contribution will allow me time to heal properly and still take care my responsibilities. My family is very important to me and providing for them is first priority your contribution will help us to maintain our home life and take care of any outstanding medical bills.   

I am asking for $3500.00 it can be all from one person or spread out amongst a lot of ones. I will be in recovery for a few weeks which during that time I will not be able to do the necessary work needed to take care of financial responsibilities at home. 100% of the contributions received will go to family assistance and any outstanding medical bills. This a time that we can really come together as one and put action to the words of unity that many of us speak. Those that do contribute to this campaign will receive a copy of The Maximum Sound album Live and Plugged as well as two DJ mixes put together by me personally with music selected by you the contributor, for those that contribute $50 and up.

The works that I do are to help make the world a better place for everyone to live. Harmony is what the planet is asking for true harmony is what makes the world a beautiful place. Your contributions will allow me to be able continue in this work by making sure my life at home remains secure until I can return to work and my family duties. This is my first personal campaign project so I don't have any others to compare it to, yet I have raised funds for others persons and organizations. My health is important to me, my family, and community while  making sure my health  is 100 or 200% is my number one goal and you can help make that happen with your contributions. No amount is too small or too large. $3500.00 from one person or $10 from 350  people the important part is to make sure that my family is properly maintained during my healing. Thank You in advance for your support.

story:
Concept

City Compost’s service, Compost EggsSM, is Earth’s first complete circle compost creation service. All compostables are collected from the customer, converted into top quality compost, and then returned to the customer. If the compost is not desired by the customer it is then available for free to anyone growing food.

Created over the period of 1 year with the help of 12 contractors and 3 lawyers, Compost EggsSM implements as natural of a solution as possible. No detail has been left untouched. 

Customers can schedule service to occur every 7, 14, or 21 days, but since we are dedicated to wiping out any chance of waste, collection can also occur when requested for overflow situations. For lowering both our costs and yours, we also offer a shared space solution.

Contribution

The major goal of this campaign is to bring Compost EggsSM to you, where-ever it is that you are. We aim to use this campaign to gauge interest and hopefully spread this service over the whole country. From Phoenix to Washington, any level of contribution will also show your interest in this service, but of course more is always welcome. 

The biggest way you can help is to spread the word. Please take the three and a half seconds to do that now. Send this to everyone you know and then come back and keep reading.

This service has the potential to create a magnitude of jobs. It is estimated that for every 100 customers, 1 job can be created. If you are interested in enabling this in your community please reach out.

The small goal of this campaign is to acquire space to implement Compost EggsSM for the Boston area. To accomplish this, we need to raise $50,000. Everything is set to go, we just need that small boost to secure space for operations. If you live around Boston please sign up. For every $30 contributed, you will recieve one free collection.

All funds raised will go towards acquisition of space  and infrastructure build out.

With our own space, we can separate material from industrial scale composting operations and ensure a top quality product. Our quality control process combined with our complete circle approach is what sets us apart from all other composting services.

Cause

While there are many reasons why we all should compost, here are three: 

1) Composting enables us to grow high quality clean food. 

2) Composting replenishes our soil, our gardens, and our Earth.

3) Composting saves money on waste removal and gardening.

Calendar

7thof August 2014 – Community Team Hiring 

7thof September 2014 – Create Infrastructure Required

7thof October 2014 – Collection Service Begins

Company

Created 1 B.E. (Before Eggs) City Compost was founded on the concept of food for our food. City Compost as an organization is divided into two pillars. At a national level, we will leverage economies of scale in technology infrastructure, compliance of regulations, capital management, and design of our next service. At the community level, teams will conduct collections, compost conversion, and customer service.

City Compost operates from 7am - 7pm, 7 days a week except for Sunday. 

Please read more at our website: www.citycompost.com 

Closing Comments

In the chaos of today's modern food system we need order. The time is now for individuals to be empowered with information they need to provide wholesome food for themselves and their families. Compost is the beginning.

If this resonates with you in any way then please connect and share as broadly as you can. Together we can connect the circle of nature.

A special thanks to Ge, Guy, Love, Colleen. 

Adam

story:
Short Summary

Herbal Healers opened its doors on July 28, 2014.  We are a small family run business specializing in organic Belizean teas.  We provide an informational tour of the garden, highlighting the medicinal properties of the plants.  You can then select which of the local plants you wish to drink as a tea.  Also available are fresh juices, smoothies, coconut water, bitters, local wine, and crafts.   In the near future, we plan on expanding our organic products to include local made soaps, salves, lotions, balms, and other body care items.  We also plan on opening up a bed and breakfast for overnight visitors.  Through your generous contributions, we will see this become a reality.

Krishna is the owner, crafts man, tea man, and head Herbal Healer.  Born and raised in Hopkins Village, the traditional knowledge of plants has been passed on to him from the elders of the community.  Over the years, his research of the medicinal properties of Belizean plants has inspired him to cultivate his own yard in an organic eco-friendly manner.  This love of plants and passion for healthy living, has led to creation of Herbal Healers.



 

What We Need

We need a total of $3,500 to help us reach our goal.  This would cover the cost of several material needed to open up the bed and breakfast and also allow us to start our line of body products. 

The list of needed items and the cost breakdown:

Bed frame and mattress:  $500

Pressure tank, water pump, pipes and installation:  $500

Small refrigerator:  $350

Stove and gas tank:  $350

Containers to make and bottle body products:  $500

Building material for signs, and shelves:  $200

Materials for production of body products (such as olive oil, coconut oil, cocoa butter, beeswax, and almond oil):  $200

Glasses, cups, and 2 coffee makers:  $100

Transportation costs:  $250

Contingencies:  $500

Paint:  $50

If we do not reach our entire goal, we will get our most immediate needs, which will be the stove and gas tanks, the bed frame and mattress, and the pressure tank, pumps, and pipes.

     

    The Impact

    Your health is your wealth.  There is nothing better than feeling good.  Through our educational tour of the local healing plants, our organic teas, juices, and (soon to be) body care products, Herbal Healers is providing an opportunity to explore the Belizean world of healthy living.  Once the bed and breakfast is open, visitors from all over the world will be able to stay in the beauty and abundance of the Herbal Healers yard.  This is an amazing opportunity and a great project to help be a part of. 


    Risks & Challenges

    There are very few risks and challenges facing us.  Herbal Healers is already open and running, so any additional support would be only moving us closer to our vision.  If we do not meet our financial goal, we will still strive towards what we want; it just may take us much longer to get there.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you are unable to give financially at this time, please pass this on to others who may be interested.  Anything helps.

story:
Short Summary

Cosplaying is the hobby of creating costumes and displaying them in public places, primarily conventions or other events of that nature. The community is tightly knit, with everyone doing what they can to help one another. This is what makes our community so great! Everyone helps and everyone is passionate about their chosen fandom, whether it's sci-fi like Star Wars, comic books like Superman or Spider-Man, anime like Kill la Kill or other fandoms such as Dungeons and Dragons or Halo. That's what ties us together. Passion!

What We Need

The Cosplay Etiquette page needs you to provide us with small donations in order for us to create more awareness within the community!

•  Funding us will give us the resources to create pamphlets, t-shirts, buttons, fliers and other branded items.

•  We will also use the resources donated to purchase table space in Artist Alley in order to have a 'home base' from which we can work to spread awareness.

•  Our funds will go entirely towards the production of our printed items as well as items we will need to make our goals come that much faster, such as notebooks, pens, and other meeting supplies.

The Impact

Donation to our cause helps to safeguard conventions. That's what the group is all about, protection of the people who attend the things we love and by extension, the things we love themselves. We want to keep conventions safe havens for everyone who attends!

Risks & Challenges

Without donations towards this cause, we could see more and more cases of harassment and other issues at our beloved pastime. We want conventions to be around for a long time so our kids and their kids can enjoy the magic of cosplaying, conventions and our fandoms!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, we fully understand. To help us, please be proactive. Please get the word out about our campaign and about our home base on facebook! We are also on Twitter @CsplyEtiquette. Check out the following links for other ways to get involved!

http://cosplayetiquette101.tumblr.com/
https://www.facebook.com/groups/546768068766584/
http://cosnation.com/cosplayetiquette

story:
For decades people have enjoyed the great homemade tastes of our family recipies. Now that my Father has retired, I am carrying on the family tradition. I was a meat cutter for years until I was stricken with Guillain–Barré syndrome, an acute polyneuropathy, a disorder affecting the peripheral nervous system. I spent 7 weeks paralyzed in a hospital, with an additional 5 weeks learning basic motor skills all over again. This ended my career as a meat cuter. I have spent the last 15 years on disability, and I would like to be able to provide for my family.

I specialize in beef and turkey jerky, pickled bologna and pickled eggs as well as sauces for chicken and beef. All of our products are homemade family recipies. We use organic eggs and local products when we can.

I am seeking a start up of $5000. This will cover the costs of the products I make, as well as packaging, advertising and a place to make our product. . I already have a large following in Northern Michigan for my Father's meats and sauces.

My Father started as a meat cutter at Halls Market when he was 15. His boss is seen in the picture behind the heat counter. Since then he has raised a family while going to college, and working his way through the Meijer Organization, retiring in 1987 to open his own grocery store, Don's IGA in Charlevoix, MI. He brought with him family recipes that were unique. Over the years we created meats and sauces that were all hand made in the store. He has now retired. I have people EVERYDAY asking about his pickled bologna and beef jerky. I would like to keep our family tradition going.

I have overcome many obstacles in my life. I am a survivor. I have been disabled since my illness in 1999. I was never supposed to even walk again. I beat the odds with determanation and a will to succeed.


Please consider my fundraiser. Even if you can't donate, just sharing is caring. Please spread the word. You have my thanks!

story:
There are 1500 shelters for battered men and women in the United States.  Animals have it better than people. That’s because there are 3800 animal shelters in this country.

“My Story and Why I Never Want to See This Happen Again to Anybody.”

I did not have any options when I left my husband.  There were no rooms available at the shelters in my city or county.  No programs in the area had funding to assist my kids and I to escape to a hotel for immediate safety.  I refused to stay in my situation!  So in desperation, I went to a hotel on the other side of town and begged the manager to help me and my kids stay safe. He was my guardian angel and accepted the only money I had at the time to provide us with shelter for a couple of weeks while I desperately searched for other options.  We moved around a lot due to the financial strain I experienced.  We ended up homeless and lost all of our material possessions because I chose to break the cycle of Domestic Violence for my family.  I want to prevent homelessness for other survivors.


The MsTreated VISION

Part of the proceeds from MsTreated T-shirt Line will provide victims monetary support for immediate shelter via hotel, etc to ensure their safety until space is available at their local shelter.  Shelter in hotels, etc is our short term goal.  

Our long term goal is to purchase houses and convert them into Safe Havens.  We will give victims the option to leave their abusive relationship without the financial burden that hinders so many from leaving their abuser.

There are not enough Safe Havens or Shelters for battered women, men, and children and they are so desperately needed.  Most victims that leave end up homeless or going back to the abuser and possibly killed for leaving in the first place. 

I realize that Rome wasn't built in a day...

Your contribution will support the production of the MsTREATED T-shirt Line.  Proceeds from the MsTREATED T-shirt Line will assist with rescuing families from the death trap of Domestic Violence by giving victims immediate assistance to escape to a safe haven.  MsTreated will partner with churches and county programs and assist victims on a referral basis.

WHAT IS A DOMESTIC VIOLENCE SHELTER OR SAFE HAVEN?

A MsTreated Safe Haven will require a significant investment i.e. buying a large enough property, qualified staff and money spent on infrastructure and services.

In the meantime MsTreated will provide immediate shelter for survivors of domestic violence via hotels until the first Safe Haven is purchased.  When enough capital is raised, MsTreated will purchase foreclosed properties and convert them into a Safe Haven for families to move into for their immediate safety.

MsTreated Safe Haven will move victims of violence from crisis to confidence and give victims the chance to become survivors.  This Safe Haven is especially important to victims who lack resources or feel they have no other place to escape. It will provide time for them to recover from any traumas as well as time to rebuild their lives.  It will also give victims the courage to leave their dangerous situations.

MsTreated Haven will provide:· 

o  24-Hour Emergency shelter with caring and trained advocates.

o  Emergency transportation

o  Emergency food and clothing

o  · Safety and wellness planning

o  · Childcare services

o  · Onsite computer lab for letters and resume writing

o  Job referrals and support

o  · In-House individual and group counseling

Our partners will provide the following services;

·  24 hour domestic violence crisis lines.

·  Safety planning for survivors of domestic violence.

·  Individual and family counseling as well as play therapy for children.

·  Trauma informed counseling for adults or children who have witnessed or experienced physical or other traumatic situations.

·  Adult support groups for survivors of domestic violence.

·  Teen support groups for survivors of domestic violence or abuse.

·  Post-traumatic stress debriefings for groups affected by violence.

·  Support groups for non-offending caregivers of children who have been abused.

·  Legal representation by pro-bono attorneys for domestic violence survivors and Assistance with restraining orders.

·  Case management including assistance accessing community resources, support networks and coordination of referrals.

·  Education and systems advocacy around the issues domestic violence, child abuse, trauma and victimization.


ABOUT MsTREATED

 MsTREATED is aimed at teens, women, and men of all ages.

This t-shirt line has been developed as a means to create an empowering and educating tool for teens, women, and men to start a dialogue about the characteristics of  LOVE…namely, what it is and what it isn't. The goal of this project is to help teens,  women, and men of all ages to recognize the signs of being “mistreated.” 

MsTreated garments for teens, women, and men is an empowerment movement which is aimed to help remind all of us that "We do not ever have to accept a disrespectful or abusive relationship,marriage, or break-up ever."

Our message is always positive and will let them know that now, there are options as well as solutions and individuals who are here and willing to help, support, and assist you when you are ready to leave an abusive situation. 

 MsTreated t-shirts come in women sizes xs-xxl and are available in a variety of colors, check out our gallery.   We also offer men's tshirts 'I Support MsTreated" sizes small-xxxl (images are available in our gallery).  Please indicate the style, size and color you would like in the comment section after your contribution is made. 

These are just a few t-shirt samples and basic fundamental principles that MsTreated T-shirt Line supports:

MsTreated Logo Shirt 

LOVE Is The Ultimate Gift

LOVE Does Not Hurt


LOVE Should Lift You Up

LOVE Is Respect

LOVE is Joy

True LOVE Is Priceless

  Statistics show that children of battered parents often become perpetrators.... 

We have to protect our teens, women, men, and children by stopping the cycle of violence!


Please support our cause. 

Your contributions will aid in rescuing families from the often times never ending cycle of Domestic Violence and Sexual Abuse.




MEN'S T-shirt 'I SUPPORT MsTreated'  (more colors in our gallery)
story_txt:
There are 1500 shelters for battered men and women in the United
States.  Animals have it better than people. That’s because there are 3800
animal shelters in this country.“My Story and Why I Never Want to See This Happen Again to
Anybody.”
I did not have any options when I left my
husband.  There were no rooms
available at the shelters in my city or county.  No programs in the area
had funding to assist my kids and I to escape to a hotel for immediate
safety.  I refused to stay in my situation!  So in desperation, I
went to a hotel on the other side of town and begged the manager to help me and
my kids stay safe. He was my guardian angel and accepted the only money I had
at the time to provide us with shelter for a couple of weeks while I
desperately searched for other options.  We moved around a lot due to the
financial strain I experienced.  We ended up homeless and lost all
of our material possessions because I chose to break the cycle of Domestic
Violence for my family.  I want to prevent homelessness for other
survivors.The MsTreated VISIONPart of the proceeds from MsTreated T-shirt Line will provide victims monetary support for immediate shelter via hotel, etc to ensure their safety until space is available at their local shelter.  Shelter in hotels, etc is our short term goal.  Our long term goal is to purchase houses and convert them into Safe Havens.  We will give victims the option to leave their abusive relationship without the financial burden that hinders so many from leaving their abuser.There are not enough Safe Havens or Shelters for battered women, men, and children and they are so desperately needed.  Most victims that leave end up homeless or going back to the abuser and possibly killed for leaving in the first place. I realize that Rome wasn't built in a day...
Your contribution will support the production of
the MsTREATED T-shirt Line.  Proceeds from the MsTREATED T-shirt Line will
assist with rescuing families from the death trap of Domestic Violence by
giving victims immediate assistance to escape to a safe haven.  MsTreated
will partner with churches and county programs and assist victims on a referral
basis. 
WHAT IS A DOMESTIC VIOLENCE SHELTER OR SAFE HAVEN?
A MsTreated Safe Haven will require a significant
investment i.e. buying a large enough property, qualified staff and money spent
on infrastructure and services.
In the meantime MsTreated will provide immediate
shelter for survivors of domestic violence via hotels until the first Safe
Haven is purchased.  When enough capital is raised, MsTreated will
purchase foreclosed properties and convert them into a Safe Haven for families
to move into for their immediate safety. 
MsTreated Safe Haven will move victims of violence
from crisis to confidence and give victims the chance to become survivors. 
This Safe Haven is especially important to victims who lack resources or feel
they have no other place to escape. It will provide time for them to recover
from any traumas as well as time to rebuild their lives.  It will also
give victims the courage to leave their dangerous situations.
MsTreated Haven will provide:· 
o  24-Hour Emergency shelter with caring and
trained advocates.
o  Emergency transportation
o  Emergency food and clothing
o  · Safety and wellness planning
o  · Childcare services
o  · Onsite computer lab for letters and
resume writing
o  Job referrals and support
o  · In-House individual and group counseling
Our partners will provide the following
services; 
·  24 hour domestic violence crisis lines.
·  Safety planning for survivors of domestic
violence.
·  Individual and family counseling as well
as play therapy for children.
·  Trauma informed counseling for adults or
children who have witnessed or experienced physical or other traumatic
situations.
·  Adult support groups for survivors of
domestic violence.
·  Teen support groups for survivors of
domestic violence or abuse.
·  Post-traumatic stress debriefings for
groups affected by violence.
·  Support groups for non-offending
caregivers of children who have been abused.
·  Legal representation by pro-bono attorneys
for domestic violence survivors and Assistance with restraining orders.
·  Case management including assistance
accessing community resources, support networks and coordination of referrals.
·  Education and systems advocacy around the
issues domestic violence, child abuse, trauma and victimization.
ABOUT MsTREATED
 MsTREATED is
aimed at teens, women, and men of all ages.
This t-shirt line has
been developed as a means to create an empowering and educating tool for teens, women, and men to start a dialogue about the characteristics of  LOVE…namely,
what it is and what it isn't. The goal of this project is to help teens,  women, and men of all ages to recognize the signs of being “mistreated.”

story:
We need to raise the last $9500 for our restaurant equipment for our space at 865 Mass Ave.  If you look at the donation tiers, you will see that the donations are almost of equal value to what you would buy in our store. We have determined that this is a more community minded and communal way to raise capital.  Thank you for letting us juice for you,

Love, The Natural Born Juicers

story:
The BIG why?

VolunCheers was created in response to the growing awareness that in a world of finite resources we can not continue to operate a linear supply chain.

Bill McKibben, Annie Leonard, David Korten, Maude Barlow, Jeff Skoll, Al Gore, Patrick Kennedy, and so many others; academicians, scientists, economists, and thought provocateurs have detailed that without a concerted effort the world ahead of us will face unprecendented challenges.

The short list includes fresh water shortage, massive migration of millions, wildfires, dead zones in oceans, toxic rivers, arable lands desertified, food shortages, epic natural disasters, etc.

VolunCheers intends to be a univesral platform which, by design, encourages more people to consider volunteering and for those who already volunteer to volunteer more often!

Origin Story

For those unfamiliar with me, Ted Regan, the brief tale is that:

“I was born on the crest of a wave and rocked in the cradle of the deep; I is, I am, I argh!”

The longer story is that I consider myself a serial social entrepreneur, in other words, someone who finds joy in creating products and services that benefit society.

 My favorite accomplishments include:

  • Leading a benefit sea-kayak expedition from Maine to Florida (1999): teaching youth along the eastern seaboard the difference between 'acceptable and unacceptable risky behavior'.
  • Assembling a team to purchase an island in Casco Bay, Maine to not only preserve in perpetuity but also to transform into a school 'Learning Adventures, Living Classrooms' for experiential environmental education.  Check out: www.rippleffect.net
  • Building an organization, KINDLE, that ‘Illuminating ideas, and Igniting Imaginations’. We produced conferences that were a front-runner to today’s TEDx. Check out: www.kindledinmaine.com

More followed but none captured my imagination as much as VolunCheers: an idea born at the Skoll World Forum 2010. The possibility of constructing a universal social platform that would enable non-profit organizations to operate more effectively and efficiently, narrowly channeling their energies into mission delivery instead of operations, excited me beyond belief! (some pirate, eh?!)

 "Trifecta!" I declared. Or rather: "Shiver me Timbers".

Considering the latest social innovations and technological tools the solution became crystal clear: By turning service HOURS into POINTS and the POINTS into a score, a MERIT SCORE, we could simultaneously benefit those in need, the non-profits that serve them, and the volunteers who are the foot soldiers of every non-profit organization!

 Why is this SO important to me?

Three reasons:

1. As a senior executive of NPOs for the last fifteen years I can honestly tell you I did NOT manage my volunteer programs well- recruiting and training- yes! But the backside: ‘tracking, recognizing and rewarding….’ there never seemed to be enough hours in the day. It still makes me ill with regret.

2. In discussion with many a volunteer, from all over the country, I will share this oft revealed secret: MOST feel “ridden hard and left out wet”, “disposable”, “just another cog in the wheel”, “I’ve been rippled”! We MUST do this better.

3. We are more than our CREDIT score! Entry to higer education, reduction in mortgage interest, access to capital;  all define your personal and professional trajectory. Too often many are shut out of these opportunities due a minor lapse in domestic responsibility. No fun, not fair.

Why might this idea be SO important to you?

Your generous gift in support of this URGENT endeavor will enable yet another star in the sharing economy constellation to alight. Specifically, it will foster more robust local economies, sustainable social service organizations, and vibrant, abundant communities.

In other words with happier, demonstrably appreciated volunteers participating in communities there will be more food served to the poor, more care delivered to the elderly, more pets given medical treatment, more trees planted, more rivers cleaned, more oceans restored, etc.

THis is important because statistically, 98% of us will be impacted one way or another by many of the concerns stated above, and will require the services of a volunteer. AND many of us who volunteer could benefit from having that data captured, posted, celebrated, affording us opportunities largely only available to those already at the apex of the food chain.

Much has been done already, but...

To date I have written a business plan, produced a slide deck, imagined and acted in a really silly promo video-(that's promo, not porno) besides conducting countless hours of interviews and creating reams of research. In addition, a draft website, a prototype if you will, has been built detailing our intentions, (hopefully you have already checked it out?!) HOWEVER, bootstrapping for 18 months has turned my knee highs into sandals, and the work has only just begun....

What will a modest gift from you mean to this project:

Your generous SUPPORT will enable us to complete FOUR important component pieces. They include:

1. FINISH the back-end engineering, and design, of the website. Including the production of a mobile app making utility effortless for the volunteer and NPO administrator.
 
2. OUTREACH & BROADCAST concept and platform creating a groundswell of interest enabling large scale early adoption necessary for platform to be successful.
 
3. REGISTER & FILE the necessary legal paperwork including patent registration.
 
4. ATTRACT funding from other sources including Technology incubators such as Maine Technolgy Institute, foundations, and angel / impact investors.
 

How else can you support this effort?

 
  • First person advocacy is extremely valuable to a start-up! Using social media or simply whispering in the ear of a loved one WILL make the difference in the success or failure of this project. PLEASE tell your friends, colleagues, children, book club, fellow Rotarians, etc. Indiegogo has great tools to enable you to easily post to FB, LI, Twitter.
  • Campaigns also need volunteers- this effort lasts for forty days, I will definitely need othesr to help promote, including writers, editors, perk packers, etc- send me an email, come to Castine to assist for a few days in May
  • Introduce me to 'rain makers'; people with the good fortune of having significant financial resources who also share the same values. This could be a family foundation, your hedge fund brother, blueberry barron cousin, or midcoast matriarch! Set up a coffee or lunch !
  • Consider hosting a group discussion in your living room with 12-20 people where I can speak to the project in more detail, field questions, brainstorm.
 
Ways to support this project are only limited by our imaginations, if you want to help BUT none of the above are possible- call me, let's discuss! I am sure we can find a fit!
 
Alright friends, family, colleagues, classmates, it's your turn to ACT. Know that whatever you are able  to do will be met with deep gratitude. In advance, thank you!!
I am eager to get this project off the ground and with your assist the time is near.
 
Cheers,
Ted

story:
Short Summary

Hello.  

My name is Doug Looms.  My wife Thelma (better known as Cookie) and I live in Larkspur, Colorado (halfway between Denver and Colorado Springs) and we need your help to avoid being evicted from our rental home.

I was laid off unexpectedly from my job at the beginning of July and my former employer provided less than two week's pay as severance.  This left us in a situation where we could only pay a portion of our August rent. 

I am already working part-time - but it does not pay enough to meet our monthly obligations.  I have also found a second part-time position that will start next week and have been blessed to find a full-time job that starts in mid-September.  This position, combined with the two part-time positions, will provide enough for us to get by.  It will also provide us with health insurance which which will reduce the cost of our prescriptions to manageable levels.  Unfortunately the new positions will not start providing income until the beginning of October and our landlord is unwilling to wait that long for us to get back on track.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $5500 to placate our landlord, pay our utilities and prescriptions until the paychecks and benefits begin. This breaks out as follows:
  •     $4500 for current and past due rent and late fees
  •     $500 for current and past due utilities
  •     $500 for prescriptions
We have already asked everyone we know for help.  Now we are asking you.

ALL the money we receive will be paid forward to charities that shelter and feed the homeless in the Denver-Colorado Springs area by the end of the year.  God works in mysterious ways and perhaps, in our need, we are also His instrument for helping others.

The Impact

If you have ever been laid off or threatened with unemployment, you know the fear and uncertainty that we are experiencing.  We have often given money to a homeless person on the street corner or someone at a gas station that needed help getting enough gas to drive home, even when we could not really afford to, because we knew these people were in more need than we were.  

If you, like us, have unconditionally helped strangers in need, please help us now.  We appreciate any donation you can make, no matter how small.  A little goes a long way when we all help each other!

Doug likes photography and cooking and Cookie has studied Middle Egyptian hieroglyphs.  To say thank you for your help, we are offering some small perks.

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be able to contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Please help us by spreading the word about this fundraiser to your friends and family (especially on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, etc.) so that as many people as possible come across our donation page.

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools! This will help increase our rankings on the Indiegogo site.

Your prayers, positive thoughts and encouraging messages are also appreciated.

Thanks again!!!

story:
English

Español

One Family, One Dream, One Journey

Hi, we are a family travelling around the world. About a year ago we began the journey of our lives driving a motor home designed and assembled by ourselves. It is a dream in which we have worked for more than 15 years.

We spent the last years looking for information and documentation to make possible this great journey throughout the five continents. We will travel about 300.000 Km and 111 countries in 80 months. Currently we are travelling across the South-American routes.

To make this trip we have got rid of many possessions even our own house. Today we are sharing a great dream with you.

Silvio 52 years old Carla 46 years old

Patricio 22 years old

Fabricio 19 years old

Lara 18 years old

Ornella 16 years old

Assembling “Libertad”- our motor home- took us 3 years working

Our mission, one purpose

We want to leave our children other teachings. We will share other values with them, as spending time together, embracing the same dream, the same mission. Our aim is to improve the world and our proposal is to encourage people to plant trees.

It would help to reduce global warming. If we can create that consciousness in each person, we will be able to change the global consciousness and contribute to reach a solution.

Why we do need financial support

We need financing to continue the trip and working in the production of the multimedia material to be followed by the web, since we have incorporated the idea of doing a documentary series of our trip, and this needs to improve the current equipment.

The idea of recording our trip in order to later make a documentary requires an improvement of our current technological equipment. We need better computers and storage equipment; we must improve the transmission and upload material; we need high-definition cameras and microphones. We need financial support to carry on working on our website.

Our motor home is an ecological vehicle which is party prepared to work using used vegetable oil but we need equipment to make it possible. We need financial support to cross the motor home to Panama, to make some mechanical changes to the vehicle, to pay visas and tolls, to take care or our health and other expenses.

Every little achievement will help us to go on seeking another one. We will buy the necessary pieces of equipment, we will look for another ways of funding. If we had to stop somewhere to do temporary jobs, the trip could take us more than expected.

We have turned to Indiegogo because we think it is a reliable platform to raise money and go on working on the documentary while travelling.

A lot of people have already joined us. They help us in this dream and accompany us in this journey. It would be impossible to do it by ourselves. Some enterprises have provided us with spare parts, services and advice. Some ordinary people have offered their support. All of them are part of this journey.

We have divided the journey into stages. The first stage will be to get to Alaska and from Alaska to New York where we will take a roll-on roll-off ship towards Hamburg, ending the first chapter which is America.

Today your support is very important since it allows us to carry on travelling and sharing stories and landscapes accomplishing our mission.

      

Do you join us?

Rewards

Note:Those who help us will appear as “contributor” in a special place on our website.

1.- Digital Postcards = $10

We send you 10 digital postcards of your choice addressed to you or someone else.
Some postcards of example:

2.- Wallpapers = $12

We send you 12 high-definition wallpapers of the most beautiful places, one for each month of the year.

3.- Digital Magazine = $12

Subscription: 12 monthly multimedia chapters containing everything about the journey as stories, anecdotes, interesting information of the places we have visited and photos, recordings and videos.

4.- Papercraft + Digital postcards = $15

We send you a digital papercraft to assemble our vehicle "Libertad"- scale of 1:50. Length: 10 inch Height: 3 inch Width: 2 inch
+
We send you 10 digital postcards of your choice addressed to you or someone else.

5.- Digital Magazine + Wallpapers = $20

Subscription: 12 monthly multimedia chapters containing everything about the journey as stories, anecdotes, interesting information of the places we have visited and photos, recordings and videos.
+
We send you 12 high-definition wallpapers of the most beautiful places, one for each month of the year.

6.- Digital Magazine + Wallpapers + Papercraft = $24

Subscription: 12 monthly multimedia chapters containing everything about the journey as stories, anecdotes, interesting information of the places we have visited and photos, recordings and videos.
+
We send you 12 high-definition wallpapers of the most beautiful places, one for each month of the year.
+
We send you a digital papercraft to assemble our vehicle "Libertad"- scale of 1:50. Length: 10 inch Height: 3 inch Width: 2 inch

7.- Your photo travel with us = $25

Your photo, full name, the name and the flag of your country, and a link to your website, blog or company will be posted on our website for 2 years.

8.- Your photo travels with us. Throughout the trip= $40

 Your photo will be printed throughout the trip on our motor home together with your full name, the name and flag of your country, a link to your website, blog or company.

English

Español

Una Familia, un sueño, un viaje

Hola, somos una familia que está dando la vuelta al mundo, hace poco mas de un año que comenzamos el viaje de nuestras vidas a bordo de una casa rodante construida por nosotros mismos, un sueño en que trabajamos más de 15 años y que hoy transformamos en realidad.

Los últimos años fueron un gran trabajo de preparación, búsqueda de información y documentación para realizar este gran viaje por los 5 continentes. Recorreremos alrededor de 300.000 km y 111 países en 80 meses, actualmente estamos recorriendo las rutas de Sudamérica.

Para realizar este viaje nos despojamos de muchas cosas materiales, hasta de nuestra propia casa...hoy estamos compartiendo un gran sueño con ustedes

Silvio 52 años Carla 46 años

Patricio 22 años

Fabricio 19 años

Lara 18 años

Ornella 16 años

Durante la construcción de la casa rodante que nos acompañara en este viaje,
a la que hemos bautizado "Libertad", un proceso que nos llevó 3 años.

Una misión, una propuesta

Queremos dejarles a nuestros hijos otras enseñanzas, compartiremos con ellos otras riquezas, el tiempo en familia, un mismo sueño y una misión: queremos contribuir a dejarles un mundo mejor y hacerlos participes de ello, con una propuesta, en cada lugar que visitamos llevamos el mensaje de plantar árboles -una solución para contrarrestar el cambio climático- si creamos esa conciencia a nivel individual, lograremos cambiar la conciencia global y contribuir a la solución.

Para que necesitamos el financiamiento

Necesitamos financiación para continuar el viaje trabajando en la producción del material multimedia para que nos puedan seguir en la web, ya que hemos incorporado la idea de hacer una serie documental de nuestro viaje, y esto requiere de mejorar el equipamiento actual. Necesitamos mejorar el equipamiento informático (computadoras para edición y medios de almacenamiento), comunicaciones (para mejorar la transmisión y subir el material a la web) y fílmico (camaras hd, steady cam, microfono, etc).

También necesitamos adquirir equipamiento para hacer funcionar el vehículo a aceite vegetal usado, ya que parte del mismo ya lo hemos preparado para tal uso, para que sea aún mas ecológico, para cruzar el vehiculo en barco a Panamá, para hacer algunos cambios mecánicos en el vehículo, que requieren de inversión, además de todos los costos que implica este viaje, visas, peajes, salud, etc.

Si cumplimos la meta parcialmente nos ayudará a continuar cumpliendo etapas. Compraremos parte del equipamiento, buscaremos otras vías de financiamiento y quizás vayamos mas lento, pues pararemos en algunos lugares para hacer trabajos temporales.

Hemos recurrido a Indiegogo pues nos parece óptimo para poder recaudar fondos y poder seguir el viaje, trabajando en la producción documental del mismo y compartir mas fluidamente el material con el mundo.

Mucha gente se sumó, nos ayuda en este sueño y nos acompaña en este viaje. Sería imposible para nosotros hacerlo solos, hay empresas que nos ayudaron con equipamiento para el vehículo, con repuestos, con servicios y asesoramiento, hay personas que nos brindaron su apoyo en forma individual de distintas maneras. Todos son parte de este viaje.

Hemos dividido el viaje en etapas. La primera etapa es hasta Alaska y de allí a New York, donde tomaremos un barco Roll On - Roll off hacia Hamburgo, concluyendo el primer capítulo que es América.

Hoy es muy importante para nosotros sumar tu apoyo, para poder seguir recorriendo kilómetros y compartiendo historias, paisajes y cumpliendo nuestra misión.

      

¿Te sumas? 

Recompensas 

Nota: todos los que nos ayudan figurarán en nuestra web como "colaboradores" en un sector especial para tal fin.

1.- Postales Digitales = u$s 10

Te enviamos diez postales digitales a elección de nuestro viaje dedicadas, dirigidas a ti o a quien tu quieras.

Algunas postales de ejemplo:

2.- Fondos de escritorio = u$s 12

Te enviamos 12 fondos de escritorio en alta resolución de las fotos de los lugares mas lindos para que los tengas en la pantalla de tu computadora. Te mandamos para un año completo para que cambies uno por mes.

3.- Revista Digital (Suscripción Anual) Rodando Ando = u$s 12

La suscripción es por 12 capítulos multimedia mensuales. La revista es con el contenido del viaje durante cada mes, historias, anécdotas, información interesante de los lugares que visitamos, fotografías, audio y video.

4.- Papercraft + Postales digitales = u$s 15

Te enviamos el papercraft digital original para armar de nuestro vehículo "Libertad". Esta realizado en escala 1:50 con los planos del vehículo. Largo= 25 cm x Alto 7 cm x Ancho 5 cm

English









Español

One Family, One Dream, One 
Journey 

 
Hi, we are a family travelling around the world. About a year ago we began the 
journey of our lives driving a motor home designed and assembled by ourselves. 
It is a dream in which we have worked for more than 15 years.

 

	We spent the last years looking for information and documentation to make 
possible this great journey throughout the five continents. We will travel about 
300.000 Km and 111 countries in 80 months. Currently we are travelling across 
the South-American routes.To make this trip we have got rid of many 
possessions even our own house. Today we are sharing a great dream with 
you.



Silvio 
			52 years old

Carla 
			46 years old 


Patricio 
			22 years 
			old
















			Fabricio
19 
			
years old



Lara
			18 
years old



Ornella 

16 years old











 

	Assembling “Libertad”- our motor home- took us 3 years working

Our mission, 
one purpose

We want to leave 
our children other teachings. We will share other values with them, as spending 
time together, embracing the same dream, the same mission. Our aim is to improve 
the world and our proposal is to encourage people to plant trees. 
It would help to 
reduce global warming. If we can create that consciousness in each person, we 
will be able to change the global consciousness and contribute to reach a 
solution. 

Why we do need 
financial support

We need financing to continue the trip and working in the production of the 
multimedia material to be followed by the web, since we have incorporated the 
idea of doing a documentary series of our trip, and this needs to improve the 
current equipment. 
The idea of 
recording our trip in order to later make a documentary requires an improvement 
of our current technological equipment. We need better computers and storage 
equipment; we must improve the transmission and upload material; we need 
high-definition cameras and microphones. We need financial support to carry on 
working on our website.
Our motor home 
is an ecological vehicle which is party prepared to work using used vegetable 
oil but we need equipment to make it possible. We need financial support to 
cross the motor home to Panama, to make some mechanical changes to the vehicle, 
to pay visas and tolls, to take care or our health and other expenses.Every little achievement will help us to go on 
seeking another one. We will buy the necessary pieces of equipment, we will look 
for another ways of funding. If we had to stop somewhere to do temporary jobs, 
the trip could take us more than expected.We have turned to Indiegogo 
because we think it is a reliable platform to raise money and go on working on 
the documentary while travelling.A lot of people have already joined us. 
They help us in this dream and accompany us in this journey. It would be 
impossible to do it by ourselves. Some enterprises have provided us with spare 
parts, services and advice. Some ordinary people have offered their support. All 
of them are part of this journey. We have divided the journey into 
stages. The first stage will be to get to Alaska and from Alaska to New York 
where we will take a roll-on roll-off ship towards Hamburg, ending the first 
chapter which is America.  



Today your support is very important since it allows 
us to carry on travelling and sharing stories and landscapes accomplishing our 
mission.




 


  

   
 




 

Do you join us?

Rewards

who help us will appear as “contributor” in a special place on our website.

Mucha gente se sumó, nos ayuda en 
este sueño y nos acompaña en este viaje. Sería imposible para nosotros hacerlo solos, hay empresas que nos ayudaron con equipamiento para el vehículo, con 
repuestos, con servicios y asesoramiento, hay personas que nos brindaron su apoyo en 
forma individual de distintas maneras. Todos son parte de este viaje.

Hemos dividido el viaje en etapas. La 
primera etapa es hasta Alaska y de allí a New York, donde tomaremos un barco 
Roll On - Roll off hacia Hamburgo, concluyendo el primer capítulo que es América. 
Hoy es muy importante 
para nosotros sumar tu apoyo, para poder seguir recorriendo kilómetros y 
compartiendo historias, paisajes y cumpliendo nuestra misión.




 


  
   


 


¿Te sumas? 


Recompensas 

Nota:

figurarán en nuestra web como "colaboradores" en un sector especial para tal 
fin.

story:
What's This All About?

Well......

I have been invited to compete for the Miss Universe Canada 2014 Pageant!!!  This year it takes place in Toronto on May 24th, 2014! With the help of my generous sponsors and their support last year, I made it into the top 20 finalists in the country in my first pageant. I think I can do even better this year, but I need your help! 


In 2013 competing for the first time in a pageant.

 


Here is my Miss Universe Bio so you can learn a little more about me:

 


Age: 26 | Height: 5’9″ |  Hometown: Mississauga


Andrea was born in Sarajevo, Bosnia in 1987.  This was a pivotal time in the separation of the former Yugoslavia that uprooted many families, including Andrea’s to Belgrade, Serbia and eventually Mississauga, Ontario. Having not spoken a word of English upon her arrival, Andrea was fluent after only 3 months! As an energetic, positive, and charismatic child, she found herself interested in dancing, acting, and modeling.

Andrea dreamed of being a performer, which led her to attend Cawthra Park Secondary School for the Arts. She would later live out that dream on a variety of stages, including TV series, commercials, print campaigns, and modeling for runway shows during Toronto Fashion Week.

Although Andrea loves modeling and acting, you can tell she has the whole package by her educational achievements. Andrea holds a degree from the University of Toronto, in political science and a diploma from Sheridan College for Digital Communications and is currently working toward getting her Canadian Securities Certification.

Andrea was working for an online advertising company in downtown Toronto but has decided to take a leave of absence to pursue her dream of being an international fashion model and is currently living in Shanghai, China. An ambitious young professional, Andrea strives to one day run a business of her own.

Her love of travel has led her to explore over a dozen countries, and she plans to visit all eight wonders of the world; she’s already crossed three off her list!

Andrea gladly welcomes the unknown and unfamiliar and looks forward to tackling any challenge that comes her way!

  

Winning Miss Universe Canada would be a dream come true. I really believe that this would provide a platform for bringing awareness to various causes and charities such as Scribble Me Silly. I’ve worked with this charity to bring the arts to young victims of violence through creative workshops put together by local artists. I've had the privilege of speaking at these workshops and it was such a rewarding experience.


I hope that with my experiences, I am able to positively inspire and encourage young women and men to go after their dreams no matter how difficult they may seem. Hard work, dedication and persistence trumps all and I really believe if I can do it, you can do it too!!!


How It Works & Why I Need YOUR Help…

 Each year, finalists from each province are asked to raise money from sponsors to cover their entry fee of $2,635.00. Since the company who runs the pageant, is a non-profit organization, that money is used to fund the week-long preparation and promotion prior to the pageant.

*Donations over $50 Are Tex Deductible. I will provide a receipt for each donation.

In exchange, sponsors’ names will appear in the official 2014 Miss Universe Canada magazine which is given to attendees the night of the event, as well as on the Miss Universe Canada website with a link to the sponsors' businesses. To me, that isn’t enough to express my gratitude for your support, and as you know I am currently in China, so I've set up a project here to make this process simple and to give you another token of appreciation with a more personal touch.

 

I want to THANK YOU so much in advance - I really couldn’t do this without your support. :) :) :)


Your future Miss Universe Canada,


Andrea C


XOXOXO

story:
Come see the World's first look at the Friendly Flosser.  This is the final design choice!  Enjoy!




After hundreds of designs, fabrications, testings and prototypes, we have chosen our final design that will begin production of the Friendly Flosser!

The process:

The Friendly Flosser is ergonomically designed to fit comfortably into your hand.  The trigger and thumb spool use the hands strongest positioning to maximize comfort while maximizing the effectiveness.  Taking advantage of the natural positioning of the thumb and fore-finger (i.e. using a hand gun trigger position or the pinch position), we were able to create a product that can easily be used using natural ergonomic positioning of the thumb and trigger finger.  The design of this product was to allow everyone to be able to use it with ease and efficiency so that even people with arthritis or a child can easily enjoy the Friendly Flosser. 

The Friendly flosser is easy to open which allows the user to change the floss spool without having to purchase a new flosser.  Spools will be available on our website for 50%-70% of traditional retail floss sales.  We will offer quality floss with an array of colors and flavors. If you do not wish to purchase our floss, simply buy your own floss and try your hand and spooling your own favorite types of floss. 

Over this process, hundreds, if not thousands, of hours have gone into making the Friendly Flosser the best possible flosser.  Our development team has tested and retested every aspect of the flosser making it ready to use without error or flaw.  You will get a consumer quality product which will not need any addition tweaking.  Our vigorous design and testing team has made sure that all possible failures simply will not come into play while using.

The Friendly Flosser was designed with the user in mind.  We have revolutionized the flossing process and we have made affordable refills that will save you money as opposed to the alternative expensive flossing devices which full of let downs.  The Friendly Flossers mission statement is simple: "An affordable refillable handheld flosser that renders the users teeth clean like they just left the dentist office!"

Ladies and Gentlemen, we are proud to introduce the World's first refillable handheld flosser that gives the user full control of the tightness of the floss, and allows the user to give each tooth gap a new strand of floss every time:

The Friendly Flosser!

 

WARNING: The Friendly Flosser is so easy to use you might get addicted.  Typical floss addicts symptoms include cleaner, whiter teeth, fresh breath, fewer cavities, healthy gums and larger wallets!

 

 

The spool will hold the approximately same or if not more floss as a tradition spool.  The Friendly Flosser allows you to use every inch of floss without wrapping it around your fingers while losing large quantities of floss, therefore Friendly Flosser Floss spools will last you a lot longer!


 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

After this tier is achieved, a preliminary survey will be sent out asking what additional Friendly Flosser colors and floss flavor options should be on the ballot. We will then post a survey online for backers to vote on their favorite floss flavors.  Votes may be cast via Twitter, text message or Internet survey. For each category, the top two will be the 2 new additions to the Friendly Flosser products.

I will say with 100% certainty that when you use the Friendly Flosser, you will never want to go back to the other outdated, unsanitary methods of flossing.  THE FRIENDLY FLOSSER TEAM thinks each one of your teeth deserves a new strand of floss without crippling your fingers in the process. This is our motto, and this is our goal, and this is why we are asking for your support to achieve a milestone goal for at home dental hygiene maintenance. 

 

\

Our rewards are listed to the right.  Our goal is to ensure that you receive the best product on the market.  For those backers that want to share with the world their excellent flossing habits, our shirts will be printed on 100% pre-shrunk cotton.  They will be available in Women and Men's sizes S, M, L, XL.  

 

 

First of all we want to thank everyone for allowing us to share our dream for a fast and efficient method of flossing. This all began when I wanted to find a better solution for flossing and has became something wonderful.  With your support, we want to make the Friendly Flosser the world's best flosser. Thanks again everyone!
