story:
How It All Started?

Baskets By JaVon was formed one day when I couldn't decide on what to give my mom for Mother's Day.  I realized that a lot of individuals have this problem; however, the quick solution, because they also don't have the time, is buying an impersonal gift card. 

The Purpose

With Baskets By JaVon I want to make gift giving warm and personal again.  I want my business to be a household name that means "stress-free personalized gifting". 

Why Do I Have Gift Baskets As a Passion? 

  • To make it easier for YOU to say what you need to say, when you can't find the right words.
  • To help Busy Individuals show appreciation to others while maintaining their busy schedules. 
  • To aid Business Professionals and Small Business Owners "stand out", make a great unique impression, when a business card can be forgetful.
  • To aid Relators make a great impression in two ways: the use of a closing/thank you basket-- so that the relators can show appreciation to the clients for trusting them with one of the biggest purchase in their lives; the use of an open house/raffle basket to generate interest to your events and a great way to build your client list. 

What Is Needed? How Much?

                                  **The need for my Crowdfunding Campaign** 

  1. Ribbon Printing Machine $1,500
  2. Light Box $49.98
  3. Camera $69.95
  4. Memberships/Advertising $3,000
  5. Replenish Inventory $1,100
If the campaign goal isn't met the remaining funds would go towards inventory, aid in the ability to participate in expos (near and far), and to assist in a stronger internet visualization.

story:
**Update!** 7/14/2014

We have reached our fundraising goal of $1,000!

Thank you so much to everyone who has contributed, donated, and supported us in trying to keep our siblings! 

We still have 5 weeks left on our campaign,  so we're going to reach for the stars and aim for $2,000!!! This stretch goal will help us establish a strong base for a scholarship to help current and future members cover their dues.

Any funds we raise over $2,000 will be donated to Hatch, which is local LGBTQIA youth organization in Houston. We would LOVE to be able to pay forward all of the kindness and generosity we've received, so please help us get there!! 



Who Are We?

Kappa is the University of Houston Chapter of all inclusive LGBTQIA sorority, Gamma Rho Lambda (GRL).  Kappa chapter dedicates our time to giving back to our community through volunteer work and supporting each other. We volunteer with local organizations including the Lesbian Health Initiative, the Houston Transgender Center, and HATCH Youth. In 2014, several of our members helped organize and volunteered for the National Gay and Lesbian Taskforce’s 2014 Creating Change conference. Despite Houston having a diverse and flourishing LGBT* community homophobia and transphobia are still strongly felt deep in the heart of Texas.


GRL Kappa chapter is a safe space and for many of our siblings, it is the only safe space they have to express themselves and be a part of our local queer community. Gamma Rho Lambda provides a social support system for our members to develop and express their gender and sexual identities as well as providing the opportunity for our members to give back to the queer community at large. Our chapter counts among its members teachers, future lawyers, engineers, pharmacists, artists, psychologists and social workers. Gamma Rho Lambda provides the support these future community leaders need to grow and our chapter wants to provide that opportunity for students regardless of their financial status.[c] We are asking for your support to help sponsor two current members who lack the financial means to be maintain their memberships, but have become valued members of our sorority.


What We Need & What You Get

Members of GRL must pay dues every semester and approximately half of this money goes to our national council so they can pay for our national insurance, which allows us to exist safely and legally on campus, and cover our national costs of operation and expansion.  While our dues are lower than many other Greek organizations due to our small size, and desire to remain accessible, we still have several members still find out fees unattainable; lack of income and familial support paired with rising costs of tuition have made several of our siblings unable to pay-in-full..

This is where Kappa chapter needs your assistance, our dear benefactors. Our initial goal of $1,000 will provide enough to cover the dues of two members for a full year, in addition to outstanding dues from the previous semester. Every semester, each active member pays $210 per semester in dues, of that $100 goes to our national council for insurance and maintenance fees, and $110 is kept by Kappa chapter to fund any events we may have, such as fellowships, fundraisers, participation fees in campus events, and events that we put on ourselves.

We have a bunch of awesome perks that some of our members and alumni have donated for contributors of our campaign. Check them out!

As a 501c7 nonprofit, all Gamma Rho Lambda chapters have a cap on how much money we can fundraise for ourselves. Should this campaign exceed that cap, the surplus will be donated to Kappa chapter’s local philanthropy, HATCH. Money we make past our goal but below our cap will be set aside as a scholarship fund for future siblings in need of support.


The Impact

This is where we tell you about how awesome we are and how much our members benefit from being a part of our family. Well, a picture's worth a thousand words, so check out some of the amazing opportunities our members have to engage in...

Service

 





Fellowship

 


Social Awareness

"Love Your Body Campaign"

 

 



Professionalism



Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone has the means to contribute financially so we greatly appreciate all attention given to our campaign. Please share, tweet, repost, tumble, Instagram, ANYTHING! When you do boost our campaign on social media, please use our tags: #KlassyKappas #GRLUH #GRLNation #GammaRhoIndiegogo

story:
HER Place is a newly-founded non-profit organization dedicated to a mission to foster HOPE, provide EDUCATION, and support RECOVERY for women suffering from alcohol and drug addiction, which drastically affects the entire family and our beloved rural Appalachian communities.

How you can help...

We plan to open a Women's Addictions Recovery Outreach Center in Huntington, WV (an office has been reserved for us - located temporarily in The Barnett Community Center on Hal Greer Blvd.)

As you can see from the above flier, there is already a women's 12-step recovery meeting being held at this location, with much-needed child-care, making it the perfect area to start offering other services for the whole family, as well!

This will provide a safe and nurturing place to offer free access to peer-based recovery support services, family education programs, and life-skills training, in addition to trauma-informed women's recovery support groups.

  • Before we can open our doors to start providing services to the women and children at risk, we are required to get liability insurance ($3,000/year).
  • You will be helping provide much-needed community support in order to save the lives of women who have a tendency to die from overdose or alcohol-poisoning before they are able to get help!
  • Your money will also help us implement a 16-week recovery program, Celebrating Families, targeted towards the entire family system for prevention - to break the intergenerational cycle of addiction that puts our youth at risk.
  • If we don't reach our financial goal (or we exceed it), the money you provide will still go towards the opening our center (which will eventually have a permanent location in The Douglas Building). 

This is a dream of many Tri-State area women in recovery, voluntarily working tirelessly on this project, who will persevere no matter what!

Impact:

The difference your contribution will make in reducing the following:

  • In WV (according to the 2011 National Survey on Drug Use & Health), 6.1% of adolescents & 19.3% of young adults (1 in 5 youth, ages 18-25) reported substance dependency in the past, over HALF of which reported needing, but not receiving treatment.
  • Substance abuse increases the financial burden on the state as billions of your tax dollars are spent on social welfare (including child-protective services), healthcare (ER visits by those without insurance), & law-enforcement.
  • The 2013 Governor's Advisory Council on Substance Abuse (GACSA) also notes how addiction affects the workforce (unemployment & absenteeism) and families, with an increase of overdose deaths (now the #1 cause of death in WV for those under age 45), a high birth-rate of addicted babies, child neglect/abuse.
  • If 75 out of 1,000 babies are born at Cabell Huntington Hospital addicted to drugs & alcohol (when the national ave. is only 5), then it is obvious that the mothers are in desperate need of assistance with remaining clean & sober.

It has been shown (see SAMHSA.gov), time and again, that participation in recovery is the #1 key to success with the maintenance of abstinence from drugs & alcohol.  Also, peer-support (recovering addicts helping other addicts) is evidence-based. As substance abuse often occurs within social groups, so does recovery! By having positive role-models within the community with a host of experiential knowledge, keeping the family together through parenting support & empowerment, while offering hope to encourage women to stay in recovery, the chances of relapse and involuntary commitments are greatly reduced (between 32%-41% in other states).

Other Ways You Can Help...

$3k goes to liability insurance (required before any services can be provided to the over 13% of drug-addicted mothers and many more single alcoholics and addicts in the area). The rest goes towards operational fees to run this campaign (perks, etc).

(If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help!)

  • Volunteers for on-going community activities are always needed!
  • Educators, social-workers, yoga instructors, musicians, etc... are ALL welcome to offer your services, pro-bono.  If you have abilities, we'll put them to good use.
  • Donations of office supplies (used equipment, furniture, filing cabinets, folders, binders, paper, clips, staples, pens, etc.) are all appreciated.
  • Please share this Indiegogo page with everyone you think can help our cause!
  • Friend Her Place on Facebook! (www.facebook.com/her.place.5)

story:
Link to Video on YouTube

Austin and Mary Van Zant have been providing fresh roasted coffee to Central Texas for more than 2 years.  Austin roasts fair trade, organic, and shade grown coffee beans and has developed hundreds of regular customers at area Farmers Markets. The beans are in restaurants, churches, and shops throughout the area. But now it is time for Redbud Roasters to start a coffee house!

What We Need & What You Get

This campaign will provide only a portion of what we need to set up the storefront. We must pay for supplies, rent, and salaries, and if we're lucky, then we can put some towards renovating the building (by far our biggest expense) to get us off the ground. It's an old building that needs a full interior makeover. It needs a counter in the front, new plumbing configurations, a new floor and ceiling, men & women's bathrooms, equipment and furniture. A coffee house is no small undertaking!

For your contribution, you will get some amazing perks. These items are exclusively for the contributors of this campaign.

The Impact

We have enjoyed our years at the farmers market, either pulling coffee on a bike trailer or driving one of our biodiesel vehicles. For two years, we were at 4 markets a week, in New Braunfels, Wimberley, and San Marcos, never missing a single market outside of a couple of holidays. We fully appreciate that we have been able to grow our business during the limited hours each week that the markets provide, even though market hours can prove inconvenient for those that need a bag of beans, or just a simple cup of delicious brew many times of the week.

We have built this business from the ground up, and it has been a labor of love. But now it is time to expand into a brick and mortar storefront. We signed a lease at a shop on the corner of LBJ and MLK, an old liquor store with a drive thru.  Here our customers will know they will get what they need when they walk in or visit the drive-thru. 

The roasting will be on-site and customers will be able to witness the beans transform during demonstrations in the back. The front of the house will have tables and lounging areas with expert baristas serving espresso drinks to be enjoyed in the relaxing atmosphere. Pounds of coffee beans and delicious locally sourced snacks will be available as well.

A Bit More About Us

We believe that solutions to global challenges lie at the local level. We see that all of our beans are fair trade, so the people that are involved with their processing are treated and compensated fairly. The beans are organic so the soil is taken care of. They are shade grown so the rain forest they grow in is taken care of. We use all compostable paper goods to reduce waste. We transport the beans to the local market on a bike trailer to reduce our fuel consumption. We have a wind turbine and solar panel system to generate power for the roaster, to reduce energy demand. We think that businesses should make changes like these for the better because every single customer, and every living thing for that matter, is to benefit from it.

Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing this campaign can greatly increase its visibility in this social media world we live in! Like it! Share it! Spread the word! Word of mouth is even better. Tell a friend, and pique their interest. After all, they want to enjoy our shop in the future as well.

Take that a step further and join our Street Team to help spread the word. Requet to join the Facebook group called "Redbud Roasters IGG Street Team" or email molly.malinowksi@gmail.com to join.

If you aren't into that sort of thing, we may need some help building the coffee house: painting, construction, decorating. If you are interested and live locally, please shoot us an email (contact@redbudroasters.com).

A Word of Thanks

We have already had so much help and support building this campaign, so we would like to give huge thanks to the community for their great loyalty, and willingness to speak on camera. Thanks to our family, particularly Alice Van Zant for supporting our dreams. Thanks to Felipe Portela for producing the amazing pitch video. Thanks to Totter Todd for producing the soundtrack music. Thanks to The Gulf Stream Ramblers (Molly Malinowski, Virginia Lee Worley, and Mary Van Zant) for performing the soundtrack music. And last but not least, thanks to all of those who love our beans, and want to see us succeed. Lots of love, Austin & Mary

story:
I want to say thank you to everyone who has donated so far and helped us reach and exceed our initial goal of $2,000 for Aubrey. This campaign is still active, so if you haven’t yet and you would like to help this family, please donate.

Update from Lindsey (Aubrey's Mommy) 7/24/12 “Bye bye hospital!! Although we have to stay in indy a bit longer, we are hospital free ;) best day ever”

Although they are out of the hopital now, the campaign is still active and they could still use your help with the large medical bills and other costs associated with having a sick child in the hospital for so long. Thank you again for all the love and support. -Chris Mathews

My cousin Aubrey is very ill and far from home. On Saturday, July 15th, Aubrey along with her family were in Indianapolis for a cheer competition (Aubrey's mommy is a coach) and became ill. They took her to an Indianapolis Children's Hospital where they found out Aubrey has a bacterial infection that is spreading throughout her body. The infection has spread from her neck to her chest. It spread too rapidly, so they did surgery to drain some of the fluid.

Right now, the family has been told that she will be in the hospital at least 2 weeks. The Ronald McDonald house is on a waiting list and apparently will not allow children to stay. Did I mention Aubrey has 2 sisters? 1 older and 1 newborn. Mom and Dad are switching between being with Aubrey in ICU and being at the hotel with the newborn (babies can't be in the ICU room after 9pm).

As you might have guessed, being far from home and having to pay for a hotel room is going to cost a lot. Not counting the mounting medical bills and time away from work. 

I am setting this up on their behalf, to help alleviate some of these costs. Anything you can give will go directly to them and might make some of this stress a little easier to manage.

Thank you!

story:
Saginaw is a city that has been struggling in many ways in recent years. The decline in the auto industry and overall economic difficulties in the state have left the city facing budget cut after budget cut, few jobs, declining population and rising frustration. If you are not from Saginaw you usually only hear about it in a negative way. This summer has been no exception with Saginaw in the national spotlight due to the shooting/killing of a homeless man by the police department, and the violent deaths of young people, most recently a 22 yr old and a 6 yr old in the same day.

More than 25% of our youth live in poverty, far too many live in fatherless homes. Violence, a poor economy and broken families mean the need for positive youth oriented programs is greater than ever.

Shiloh's Lighthouse Ministry is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that has since its inception been offering a variety of positive programs to young people in the Saginaw area. Currently our desire is to fully fund our vision to have a youth center in our facility, a former church building.

Shiloh Youth Center is prepared to be part of the answer for young people and their parents here in the Saginaw area. We need your help. We are currently located in a former church building that houses our successful boxing program Shiloh Boxing Club, a USA Amateur Sanctioned Boxing Program. We have the space to be able to expand our programming including:

  • Dance classes for girls. This unique program will offer girls the opportunity to learn a challenging, fun and entertaining form of dance. Dance is physically demanding and helps the girls get into great shape while also providing them with positive mentoring from the instructors who teach them to love and respect themselves as they grow into young women.

  • After School Program – offering a free healthy meal, computer stations to do homework, tutoring and special skills training from art, to music to culinary arts

  • Mentoring – trained caring adults who will become an important part of young people's lives offering a caring ear, time to spend with young people in one-on-one settings as well as offering additional support to their family

In our current program, Shiloh Boxing Club and those to follow, we help every young person understand the importance of doing their best in school (our fighters must show us their grades and receive tutoring when help is needed). The goal is to help every young person we reach to graduate from high school with a strong self image and a personal vision/direction for where their adult life is headed.

We face a significant financial challenge in order to continue not only our boxing program, but to expand and fully offer the above mentioned programming in our facility. Pastor Dana, the Founder and President of the non-profit Shiloh's Lighthouse Ministry has been struggling often with little to no support these past few years to try to keep the facility from closing. Recently a new Board of Directors joined forces with him and have set forth aggressive goals to not only keep the boxing club going, but to grow into a full youth center.

The facility we are in is in need of many updates and repairs including a new roof, a privacy fence (as required by the Township Zoning Board), parking lot updating and home repair of the house Pastor Dana lives in (right beside our facility) including expanding the space so that he will be able to take in more foster children. When you watch the video about our building on our web site you will see there is much work to be done! This campaign is the first phase of our determination to raise well over $300,000 to pay off the Land Contract on the building, repair it and operate with a full slate of programming. In addition to this campaign we are seeking out grants and linking arms with other non profits in the area to help strengthen the services we can offer to young people here in the Saginaw area.

In order to save our facility from foreclosure, to bring our facility up to code and to provide a safe place for young people in a city that desperately needs as much positive programming for young people as it can get, we have launched this first phase in our capital campaign. A donation of any amount will make a difference! Please don’t think if you only have $5, $10, of $20 to give that it won't help. Check out the video in the gallery to see what you could do with a $5 donaiton challenge! Thanks to this web site you can help us spread the word about our need all over the world!

Will you be part of the miracle? Donate today, then pass along the link to our campaign and challenge your friends to do the same. Together you will be making a real difference in the lives of young people while helping us take back the city of Saginaw from the despair and violence it is now most known for. Thank you for checking out our campaign. Thank you for your donation! Thank you for sharing it with your social network. Please visit our web site and our Facebook pages and follow us to learn more about us as we meet and exceed our fund-raising goals.

Visit our web page to learn more about us - Shiloh Youth Center

Like our Facebook Pages - Shiloh Youth Center - Shiloh Boxing Club
story_txt:
Saginaw is a city that has been struggling in many ways in recent years. The decline in the auto industry and overall economic difficulties in the state have left the city facing budget cut after budget cut, few jobs, declining population and rising frustration. If you are not from Saginaw you usually only hear about it in a negative way. This summer has been no exception with Saginaw in the national spotlight due to the shooting/killing of a homeless man by the police department, and the violent deaths of young people, most recently a 22 yr old and a 6 yr old in the same day.
More than 25% of our youth live in poverty, far too many live in fatherless homes. Violence, a poor economy and broken families mean the need for positive youth oriented programs is greater than ever.
Shiloh's Lighthouse Ministry is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that has since its inception been offering a variety of positive programs to young people in the Saginaw area. Currently our desire is to fully fund our vision to have a youth center in our facility, a former church building.
Shiloh Youth Center is prepared to be part of the answer for young people and their parents here in the Saginaw area. We need your help. We are currently located in a former church building that houses our successful boxing program Shiloh Boxing Club, a USA Amateur Sanctioned Boxing Program. We have the space to be able to expand our programming including:


Dance classes for girls. This unique program will offer girls the opportunity to learn a challenging, fun and entertaining form of dance. Dance is physically demanding and helps the girls get into great shape while also providing them with positive mentoring from the instructors who teach them to love and respect themselves as they grow into young women.


After School Program – offering a free healthy meal, computer stations to do homework, tutoring and special skills training from art, to music to culinary arts


Mentoring – trained caring adults who will become an important part of young people's lives offering a caring ear, time to spend with young people in one-on-one settings as well as offering additional support to their family

In our current program, Shiloh Boxing Club and those to follow, we help every young person understand the importance of doing their best in school (our fighters must show us their grades and receive tutoring when help is needed). The goal is to help every young person we reach to graduate from high school with a strong self image and a personal vision/direction for where their adult life is headed.
We face a significant financial challenge in order to continue not only our boxing program, but to expand and fully offer the above mentioned programming in our facility. Pastor Dana, the Founder and President of the non-profit Shiloh's Lighthouse Ministry has been struggling often with little to no support these past few years to try to keep the facility from closing. Recently a new Board of Directors joined forces with him and have set forth aggressive goals to not only keep the boxing club going, but to grow into a full youth center.
The facility we are in is in need of many updates and repairs including a new roof, a privacy fence (as required by the Township Zoning Board), parking lot updating and home repair of the house Pastor Dana lives in (right beside our facility) including expanding the space so that he will be able to take in more foster children. When you watch the video about our building on our web site you will see there is much work to be done! This campaign is the first phase of our determination to raise well over $300,000 to pay off the Land Contract on the building, repair it and operate with a full slate of programming. In addition to this campaign we are seeking out grants and linking arms with other non profits in the area to help strengthen the services we can offer to young people here in the Saginaw area.
In order to save our facility from foreclosure, to bring our facility up to code and to provide a safe place for young people in a city that desperately needs as much positive programming for young people as it can get, we have launched this first phase in our capital campaign. A donation of any amount will make a difference! Please don’t think if you only have $5, $10, of $20 to give that it won't help. Check out the video in the gallery to see what you could do with a $5 donaiton challenge! Thanks to this web site you can help us spread the word about our need all over the world!
Will you be part of the miracle? Donate today, then pass along the link to our campaign and challenge your friends to do the same. Together you will be making a real difference in the lives of young people while helping us take back the city of Saginaw from the despair and violence it is now most known for. Thank you for checking out our campaign. Thank you for your donation! Thank you for sharing it with your social network. Please visit our web site and our Facebook pages and follow us to learn more about us as we meet and exceed our fund-raising goals.

story:
As we close out our campaign -  We missed the goal for Indigogo,  AND we did find a solution that will get us to the next stage.  The funds we raised here helped bridge that gap!  Thank you so much!

Organic Soda Revolution                
                
Founded in 2009, Oogavé is a young, growing organic soda company based in Denver, Colorado and we could use your help!                 
                
As many people know, it takes the average company about 5 years to become profitable.  And cash flow is critical!  We've found ourselves short on cash, but long on opportunities and successes!  Sometimes you just need an extra push to get to the next phase!
                
If we were a big soda giant like P**** or C***, we wouldn't be calling on our organic-loving community for support.  Alas, we don't have deep pockets and gargantuan ad budgets like they do.  We hustle, negotiate and pour our hearts into this business.  We do it because we are passionate about having healthier options available for soda lovers everywhere.      

 

        
                
Why do you need the money?                
The "Big-2" soda companies each sell more in 20 seconds than Oogavé sells in an entire year, no kidding!  Oogavé is definitely the underdog and needs your help.  We began four years ago in Denver, CO with a mission to bring a healthier soda to market, not knowing anything except that we had an awesome soda on our hands. Needless to say, it's been a lot tougher than we anticipated.                 
                 
In order to escape the shadows of the big giants and make sure we reach all of the consumers who would love to find us, it takes a lot... a lot of case sales and economies of scale.  That requires a lot of money, which is where we have run short.  We've always been a boot-strapping company and have turned precious few resources into great opportunity.  At this point we have fully allocated all of our own personal funds, our friends and family money, and our small investment capital.  We are nearing the goal line of cash flow positive, which will ensure our long-term viability.  Most start-ups take at least 5 years to stabilize.  This year is our 4th birthday and we are projecting another 18-24 months to become self-sustaining.             

               
If you want to support a mom & 'pop' operation (pun intended), care about the little guy, wrinkle your nose at corn-syrup, push for more organic food products, buy independent, dream big, and keep the dolphins safe, then we implore you to please participate with us at the highest level you can.  Each of these has its own reward for you, with great karmic implications!                                
                
What happens if you don't raise enough money?                
First and foremost, we will have a good solid cry.  Then, we'll pull ourselves up off the floor and take care of business.  All rewards will be delivered as promised regardless of the amount raised.  If we fall short of our goal, we'll continue to produce our awesome soda for as long as we can keep the doors open.  We are reducing all non-critical expenses and running parallel conversations with many new potential capital partners to help us grow.  We are confident that an investor will make up the difference with an equity investment and keep us moving forward.        

 

     
                
If you reach your goal, will you have all you need to move forward on your own?  Our goal is to raise $500,000 which will help get us to cash flow positive in the next 18-24 months.  Once we hit that tipping point we can grow organically.             
                
What will you use the money for?                
Your contribution will go towards the many operational costs of the business, including; overhead, marketing costs, sales promotions, tradeshows and keeping jobs alive in the organic sector.  We will be on track to grow our base of sales to a sustainable, long-term profitable level.  We also will be able to continue the development and launch of our diet version, Oogavé LoCa.  Just 10 calories!  Get excited!                
                
How can I get more involved with your efforts?                
Run to the top of your nearest mountain and scream, "I LOVE OOGAVE!!!" at the top of your lungs.  If this is not feasible, you can settle for telling all your friends about our great organic soda, blow up the social media universe (don't be shy about sharing on FB, Twitter, Pinterest, your blog, etc), get an Oogavé tattoo on your arm, or name your pet after your favorite Oogavé flavor.                
               


What's the story behind Oogavé?                
The idea for Oogavé organic sodas first came to Esteban Anson while running his small natural foods restaurant in downtown Denver. As a fanatic of quality, and a devotee of delicious and wholesome handcrafted foods, Esteban used only the best natural ingredients in his restaurant.                 
                
But when it came time to order sodas, Esteban and his customers were still frustrated by the lack of quality and choice in the world of soft drinks. Wanting to offer a variety of fountain sodas, Esteban was dismayed at the treatment and options available through the traditional “evil empire” soda companies. He didn’t want to sign his life away in iron-handed contracts, and he especially didn’t want to serve his customers anything made with processed sugar and High Fructose Corn Syrup. What to do? Esteban thought, "Why not make my own all natural soda? Heck, why not even make it organic?"         
                
Esteban was already a huge fan of agave nectar, using it in much of his baking and as a sugar substitute in many sauces and recipes. Esteban thought this wonder nectar just might make a delicious and healthier soda. And he was right! Read more at: http://www.oogave.com/index.cfm/about-us/           
               

REWARDS!*

 

 

 

NEW PERK!

 

 

 

 

 

 

* All rewards are available in the US only.  Continental US only for Oochero Party.

*All shipped cases of Oogave contain 12 bottles each

*Custom Soda cases contain 24 bottles each

               
Links to more info:                              
                
To learn more about our campaign, visit the Save Oogavé website    www.SaveOogave.com            
                
Official Oogavé website:    www.Oogave.com                      

Hear what our fans say:    www.SaveOogave.com/FanPage         

More Campaign FAQs:   www.SaveOogave.com/FAQs

story:
General information about us and our vision.

Who we are and what we do.

Futura-Tech A.S is a new established Norwegian, innovation company providing creative solutions for idea- and project development. Such as web and app design, programming, marketing, advertisement and sales. Our team consists of visionary, creative, young entrepreneurs with ambition for success. 

Success for us, means the freedom and power to create and manifest all wonderful imaginations and ideas into our world. Or at least be a part of it,

Our philosophy.

We like to believe that our reality consists of infinite atoms containing an all powerful energy just known as "empty-space." Thought, imagination and intention is what fills up this "empty-space" and our reality becomes what we feel, think and perceive. In other words, it becomes life. 

Take a look around you. Everything you see, is the product of someone else's imagination. It becomes your world!

How do we achieve success?

Our team have sharp people with different set of skills, from different backgrounds all working very close for the best possible solutions while keeping our company philosophy in mind. 

We are small compared to other well established companies, but we aim bigger. We have vision, ideas, ambition, creativity and motivation. But we lack the grandest of all, money. 

This is the beginning of our journey. For now, we solely depend on economical solutions given to us by people like you. In return you are guaranteed good results/products with soul and quality at an affordable price unlike what you get in the mainstream market where more profit for the few is more valued than advancement and quality for all. 

Our keywords for achieving success is excellent service, hard-work, colorful creativity and a ultra-strong dedication on top of it all.

Current project

The idea behind this current project is created and owned by Loud'n louder A.S and its founder Roberto Aghaei with all copyrights. All fundings will be used by Loud'n louder for covering production expenses.

Futura-Tech is assisting with web design, visual advertisement, marketing, sales and customer support. As part of the promotion, Futura-Tech created this fund raiser campaign. We are currently also working on designing, creating and launching loudnlouder.com which will be Loud'n louder's official website.


Our campaign and idea.

Loud'n louder. Turning sound into color!

One of our greatest scientists once said: " If you want to find the secrets to the universe, think in terms of  energy, frequency and vibration." 

Before this great scientist, one of our greatest philosophers once said: "Music is a moral law, it gives soul to the universe, wings to the mind and flight to the imagination…"

So, scientifically and spiritually we can say that sound is invisible waves of wondrous energy flowing through space, affecting us in miraculous ways. 

So, let sound constantly flow. Through your magnificent, infinite soul and bring the music with you where ever you go. 

Now where ever you are, no matter under which star. Turn the sound of your joy, into your color. And play it loud, with Loud'n louder!

Product description and specifications.

Sound is powerful, therefor its essential to have a sound source with quality sound waves. The sound and salt experiment in our fund raiser ad shows just a little bit how important and vital sound can be.

A portable, multi-functional, waterproof mini-speaker in fresh, single colors designed for pure sound and user quality is what we have in mind. The speaker is 12 cm long, 6 cm wide and 3 cm thick and comes with a magnet on the back for attachment to other magnetic surfaces, Loud'n louder speakers or smart phones.

On top, there will be a ON/OFF button, a plug for a DC/5V charger, two plugs for AUX and +/- volume adjuster buttons. 

On the back of the speaker there will be an invisible, super magnet which you can use to attach a second speaker, for even smoother and louder sound.

More specifications.

  • All necessary cables will follow.
  • A speaker comes in a single color (pink, blue, black, white and silver) 
  • The speaker has a notifying light on the front grid (the white stripe around the grid). The "light notifier" will be white when battery power is normal and turn red when its below 20% and blink three times when fully charged. If you missed the blinking. Unplug and replug the charger to see the blinking again.
  • The brand name will be right in the middle of the grid. It will glow just like the "light notifier" around it.
  • Battery life guaranteed: 15 - 120 hours.
  • Battery info: Lithium ion, 2200 MAH - 3.7V
  • FC and CE approved for use in Europe and America.
  • Frequency: 150HZ - 18KHZ
  • The speaker has no buzzing sound when playing on max volume or when its silent and on stand-by.
  • A speaker comes with an elegant, transparent case which you can always use as a container for the speaker.
  • Possibilities of registering you're device on the Loud'n louder website for future need of support, happenings and perks. When 10.000 people register their speakers on loudnlouder.com a lucky winner of an Iphone/Ipad or another cool prize will be picked on a regular basis.
  • The speaker is purposefully designed for those who need an alternative sound source by the beach, on picnic, in the shower or anywhere else that you could think of where a stationary sound source is not available at that moment. 
  • Since the speaker has exactly the same dimensions as an Iphone. The speaker can be attached to your Iphone or any other smart phone and be carried around together as one unit thanks to a super strong magnet on the backside of the speaker.


Funding and development.

We need 25.000 dollars (148.000 Norwegian kroner) to fund and develop the entire project. When developed, the speakers will be sold for 399 Norwegian kroner in Scandinavia and for roughly around 49 dollars in the US/Canada. Our strategy is to sell at standings in festivals, malls and on the street to begin with. The speakers can also be ordered on www.loudnlouder.com which is currently being designed and developed by Futura-Tech. All the funds donated to us will be used to pay the bills. Which means paying all employees who contributed to the design and is contributing to the mass production of the device. We really want to make this happen, but honestly we need your help.

If we don't reach our funding goal, what ever donations ever made will be appreciated from the bottom of our entire teams heart. And we will put the funding no matter amount, to good use within the project. 

There is a lot of portable mini-speakers out there. But non is produced to last. We truly put time and effort into our projects and want to give people quality which can last for a long time. After our calculations the first physical, prototype will be ready by the beginning of June and by the end of August we will have mass produced enough speakers for sale. Around 2000 + to start with.

If you like us, our vision and our idea. We can say with excitement that this will be just one of many projects that we will campaign and raise funds for here on www.Indiegogo.com


Created by Futura-Tech A.S for Loud'n Louder A.S - all rights reserved.

All necessary cables will follow.
A speaker comes in a single color (pink, blue, black, white and silver) 
The speaker has a notifying light on the front grid (the white stripe around the grid). The "light notifier" will be white when battery power is normal and turn red when its below 20% and blink three times when fully charged. If you missed the blinking. Unplug and replug the charger to see the blinking again.
The brand name will be right in the middle of the grid. It will glow just like the "light notifier" around it.
Battery life guaranteed: 15 - 120 hours.
Battery info: Lithium ion, 2200 MAH - 3.7V
FC and CE approved for use in Europe and America.
Frequency: 150HZ - 18KHZ
The speaker has no buzzing sound when playing on max volume or when its silent and on stand-by.
A speaker comes with an elegant, transparent case which you can always use as a container for the speaker.
Possibilities of registering you're device on the Loud'n louder website for future need of support, happenings and perks. When 10.000 people register their speakers on loudnlouder.com a lucky winner of an Iphone/Ipad or another cool prize will be picked on a regular basis.
The speaker is purposefully designed for those who need an alternative sound source by the beach, on picnic, in the shower or anywhere else that you could think of where a stationary sound source is not available at that moment. 
Since the speaker has exactly the same dimensions as an Iphone. The speaker can be attached to your Iphone or any other smart phone and be carried around together as one unit thanks to a super strong magnet on the backside of the speaker.
Funding and development.We need 25.000 dollars (148.000 Norwegian kroner) to fund and develop the entire project. When developed, the speakers will be sold for 399 Norwegian kroner in Scandinavia and for roughly around 49 dollars in the US/Canada. Our strategy is to sell at standings in festivals, malls and on the street to begin with. The speakers can also be ordered on www.loudnlouder.com which is currently being designed and developed by Futura-Tech. All the funds donated to us will be used to pay the bills. Which means paying all employees who contributed to the design and is contributing to the mass production of the device. We really want to make this happen, but honestly we need your help.If we don't reach our funding goal, what ever donations ever made will be appreciated from the bottom of our entire teams heart. And we will put the funding no matter amount, to good use within the project. There is a lot of portable mini-speakers out there. But non is produced to last. We truly put time and effort into our projects and want to give people quality which can last for a long time. After our calculations the first physical, prototype will be ready by the beginning of June and by the end of August we will have mass produced enough speakers for sale. Around 2000 + to start with.If you like us, our vision and our idea. We can say with excitement that this will be just one of many projects that we will campaign and raise funds for here on www.Indiegogo.comCreated by Futura-Tech A.S for Loud'n Louder A.S - all rights reserved.

story:
OUR STORY

I love making custom tee shirts!  I started my company in 2011 when I retired early from my engineering job.  I wanted to be involved with a creative business that I could run the way I wanted to run it--no hidden fees, no minimum purchase required, and an open door policy where anyone can stop by and watch me work.  It's been great and my business is growing steadily.

There is one aspect to screen printing tee shirts that I'm not happy with--making screens.  Making each screen requires the use of several not-so-nice chemicals and about 20 gallons of water.  It takes about 2 hours to make a screen and another hour to clean it up and get it ready to use again.


There is a better way--a printer which thermally prints on a special film and spits out the screen mesh ready to use!  No chemicals, no water and only about 10 minutes of time.  When I'm done with the screen, I just cure the ink that's on it and drop it in my plastics recycling bin.  Check out this video to see how it works.  

Why is this so important to me?  I live in Central Texas and we are experiencing the most severe drought in history.  It breaks my heart to be using 20 gallons of water for every screen I make.  Sometimes it is 10 or more screens a day.  The chemicals required are petrochemical based, and everyone knows what's going on there.

Central Texas is dry but it is also incredibly beautiful.  I want to do everything I can to preserve and protect my little part of the world.  I was born and grew up in Texas.  It's a special place and I want to do my part--and more--to protect it.

Here's How You Can Help

  • How much funding am I asking for?  $12,000  We'll use this money to purchase an Xpress Screen GOCCOPRO printer, as well as all the film and film holders needed to completely replace our existing screens.
  • The Xpress Screen GOCCOPRO printer will connect to my design computer and print the screens directly.  I will eliminate the need for emulsion and press wash and have no need to use water in the process.
  • For your contribution of $25, you'll get a tee shirt which I have designed specifically for this project.  For your $100 contribution, you'll get 5 tees, any sizes you want. If you can contribute $1000, I'll design a custom logo or tee shirt design for you.  You'll get up to 10 tees and the design files for your own personal use.
  • If I don't reach my funding goal, I'll still put the money that is contributed to good use.  If I don't have enough to purchase the GOCCOPRO printer and supplies outright, I will finance the purchase and pay the remainder over time.

The Impact

As a small business, I can't always make a big impact, but with this equipment change, I can.  This new printer will have a direct environmental impact.  About 100,000 gallons of water will not be used to make screens each year.  I can continue to offer my customers no minimums and no screen charges because this will help keep my costs lower.

I want our world to stay vibrant and beautiful.  I want to do my part by reducing my business's impact.  You can help me by contributing.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know everyone can't afford to contribute money, but you can still help.

Tell people you know about my campaign.  Use Indiegogo's share tool and help me get the word out.

Thank you!  Thank you!  Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Since February 2011 I have been tweeting out information to the followers and more in the city of Hamilton from @HSRTransit about public transit in the city. The Twitter account began as a hobby and as something that I started to help those who took transit get real time access to information about transit.

On February 13th, 2012 I began the Hamilton Transit Blog, originally hosted on Blogger. My goal with the blog was and is to bring more extensive information about transit. Fleshed out and easily accessible information about detours, news about upcoming service changes, details of transit presentations being brought to council as well as a multitude of other information. In May of 2013 I upgraded that blog with paid hosting and a top-level domain at www.HamiltonTransit.ca.

Since that time the blog has expanded somewhat and the focus on the Twitter account has as well. Not only do I do my best to provide details on detour and service changes for the Hamilton Street Railway, but have also done the same for other public transit that Hamiltonians use. Buses from both GO Transit and Burlington Transit operate on the city streets in Hamilton so information on those systems as it relates to the daily commute of those who live here is just as important to me.

And I do all of this on my own time, on my own dime and without any official support; support that I don't think is coming any time soon.

Having been inspired by the can-do attitudes of so many others I decided that I would attempt a crowd-funding campaign to see if the transit riding community at large would support my unofficial endeavours. I'm keeping this support target small and modest, looking to only attempt to offset the actual annual cost of operating the website - domain and hosting costs.

What We Need & What You Get

The total cost amount for the domain and one year of hosting for HamiltonTransit.ca runs a total of $134.56. The goal doesn't seem that far out of reach. In fact the Twitter account for the Hamilton Transit Blog (@HSRTransit) as of this writing has 2,222 followers. If every follower were to donate just 6 cents I would reach my goal. Indigogo has a minimum fundraising goal of $500, so anything raised beyond the one year goal will be applied to years beyond.

Supporters will receive a few different things as a thank you, including a personal email thank you card, a supporter button, advertising space on the blog as well as PRESTO cards, so you can take transit!
The Impact

The funding will go towards paying for the hosting of the website. After suffering a recent job loss I've had to take a long hard look at my expenses, with the cost of hosting and the domain as one of those.

One thing to bear in mind is that the blog will in no way disappear if the funding goal isn't reached. I will find the funds somewhere to keep things up regardless.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't worry if you can't contribute. Spreading the word about the campaign is also very important and will be greatly appreciated!

  • Spread the word on Twitter and Facebook!.
  • You can also use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

I am Christo Alberts, a Filemaker Developer and a Filemaker Database Host provider. I started developing in Filemaker in 2005, building my expertise and knowledge of what can be done in Filemaker.

The time has come where Filemaker has improved their technology and I need to upgrade to the current technology. To be able to provide an up to date and stable environment. I already host a range of Filemaker 12 Databases on a public server and is working wonders. Having said that, have I come to realize the features that will attract more clientèle to my business.

I have found that there are people who do have a Filemaker solution, but would like to make use of the new features in Filemaker 13 when hosted. Please see the link of the comparison matrix of the various versions and you will see why this is necessary. http://www.filemaker.com/products/filemaker-server/server-history.html#fms13

What We Need & What You Get

We need a 25 user Filemaker Pro License and a 5 user Filemaker Pro Advanced license. 1 x Filemaker Server 13 license with a 50 concurrent connection. Please see video link. http://fmdl.filemaker.com/MISC/fmp13/product-buying-guide-video_848x480_en.mp4

So when the funding is received, the server will be upgraded and Filemaker server with the Clients will be installesd Currently the server is hosting Filemaker 12 Advanced. 

The server is also used as a small office tool for clients who require a cloud office. It is running Windows 7 prof virtual desktop and have Office 2013 professional with Viseo included. The server is also a web and mail server.

So, what is in it for me you ask. Well, have a look at the perks listed, and you will see a range of gifts or tasks that can benefit you. From basic Filemaker solution for your iPad, iPhone devices or Mac and Windows solutions, to robust solutions that can be used in your business.

All the funds, even if we don't reach our goals, will go towards the server upgrade, as we know how important it is to stay current, and up to date, it will just take a while longer, but the goal will be reached. 

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.
This won't only be a business tool, but community will also benefit, especially for new or current Filemaker developers who can't afford to purchase their own licenses. 
It will also be used for people who would like to host their solution online, for other people to use, like community centres who shares data, but can't afford the infrastructure to accommodate their needs.
As I have said, I am currently running a server with a Filemaker 12 solution, but the benefit of upgrading it to Filemaker 13 solution will be far more beneficial.
Please watch this space for updates.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone has the means to make a contribution but there are ways you can help me.

1. You can spread the word about this campaign, and people will really benefit from this..

2. You can share my links so that I can get more business in to sow into this campaign. Here are the links.
http://www.fiverr.com/users/christoalberts/manage_gigs/advise-you-on-your-filemaker-project/edit

http://www.fiverr.com/users/christoalberts/manage_gigs/test-your-website-or-software-as-a-user/edit

http://www.peopleperhour.com/freelancer/christo/filemaker-developer-web-developer/667124

story:
Our Story

Hello there!

We are Rose Chang & Stephanie Drabik, and together we run Crywolf. Crywolf is our online shop (www.crywolfclothing.com), where we design everything you see on the site and make the majority of it, with a few exceptions. We have based ourselves on a very DIY motto through the start of our business, and want to continue to do so. We have been  working out of our basement studios, and selling online and at trade shows trying to build our brand for the past 8 years. We feel that at this point, we have outgrown our home-based studios and the natural next step would be to gain our own little space in this big city! After years of contemplating and months of searching, we have taken the plunge and found and secured a retail/studio location in downtown Toronto which will be the new home of Crywolf! This is a HUGE step for us, and we can't do it alone.

Here is where you come in!

Why we need you

We have always relied heavily on the support of our fans and customers to keep going and keep growing. By purchasing one of our incentives, you will not only get an awesome Crywolf prize pack but you will also be contributing to help Crywolf, a local small business, continue to grow.
 
Our location will be at 91 Ossington Ave. in Toronto, Ontario. It will double as a retail and studio space where we will both create and sell magical things! Our lease will take effect in July but we plan on having our official opening in September 2013. Since making this commitment recently, we know that we need the support of our community and the fan base that we have built to make this dream come true!

Breakdown

We have found and secured our retail location - but now we need your help! We are asking for $15,000.00. We would use the money towards:
  • Getting equipment for the store (shelving and fixtures, lighting and POS hardware)
  • General renovations (we need money to obtain permits, installing display units, paint, redoing the ceiling, and general fixer-uppers)
  • Setting up our studio with a space to facilitate screen printing and also to host public workshops
  • All funds raised will go directly towards setting up and completing our store. If we do not reach our goal we will accomplish as much as we can with what we have. Any money left over will be used to get a head start on inventory.
In order to express our gratitude for donating money to our cause, we wanted to come up with really great incentives/prize packs. Each prize is unique to this campaign - the designs are custom and in limited edition colourways so you know you are getting something truly special when you donate! 

The Impact

We also plan on giving back to the community that supports us by having workshops that anyone can sign up for and learn about screenprinting and other fun projects. We want to feature artists work in our shop in order to support new and upcoming local artists. Up until this point we have lived our lives doing what we love but are at a critical point where we need to expand and see where it takes us. We could never have gotten where we are today without our fans have supported us in our journey thus far and we hope you believe in this campaign as much as we do!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone may be able to contribute financially, but that doesn’t mean we can't use your help! We would love it if you could help get the word out about our campaign - spread it like a wildfire! The Indiegogo share tools make it super easy. 

and finally, we want to give our biggest THANK YOU for taking the time to explore our campaign and considering our project!  

 

PERK NOTES:

Shipping is INCLUDED in ALL perks!! 

Check out our designs in the Gallery, we will periodically be adding pictures.

Please indicate in your notes which Size you are, and which Shirt/Print design you would like:

1. Crywolf

2. Crywolf x Nik Dudukovic

3. Crywolf x Chris Cresswell

Women's or Unisex SMALL, MED, LARGE, or XL.

Custom Sizes upon request!

We will start sending packages out in 2 weeks time.

 

Crywolf Shirt Design

Crywolf X Nik Dudukovic Shirt Design

 

Crywolf collaborative design by  Chris Cresswell of The Flatliners and Goddamn Design.

story:
Who We Are

  • In 2010, we launched the first year of the Denton Community Market. Our humble beginnings were in a parking lot only once a month. Since then we have grown to an every Saturday market in a historic park with over 70 members who grow, make and create things that are important to them.
  • As we embark on our fifth market season in 2014, we have set very high hopes and goals to grow the market and the reach it has in our region. We are at a turning point, and we need training to get to that important next step.
  • The workshop: "How to Create Successful Markets" from the Project for Public Spaces will show us what other market's have done and give us the information we need to move forward.
  • With your help, we can receive the training we need that will propel the Market into a transformative fifth season and will provide us with tools we need to have a solid foundation for the future.

What We Need

The "How to Create Successful Markets" trip fees: 

  • Conference Fees for 2 People: $1100.00
  • Meals for 2 People for 4 Days: $400.00
  • Travel Costs for Taxi and Subway: $200.00
  • Indiegogo + Prize Costs: $600.00
  • Total Trip + Fundraising Cost: $2300.00
  • Free Flights for 2 People: $0.00
  • Free New York Stay for 3 Nights: $0.00

What You Get

  • For your support and contributions we have lots of wonderful prizes that include gift baskets of produce and handmade items from our vendors, a special invitation to the community workshop where we share what we learned from the training with you and a handmade market mug with your name on it, thanking you for your contribution! 

  • Any funds raised over our goal will go toward the market operations for 2014. 

The Impact

The Denton Community Market is a pioneering organization in Denton. Our commitment to local and organic food, local handmade items and sustainable practices position us a unique market in the region. You can support the growth of the Market and the increase the access of local organic food and locally-created handmade items for the residents of Denton and beyond.

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can’t contribute funding today, but you can still help! 

  • Share the Indiegogo link on your personal and business Facebook pages
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to increase our ranking on Indiegogo
  • Come out the Market and join our community

Thank you so much for your trust and support!

In Community, 

Kati Trice & Vicki Oppenheim

-------

Kati Trice, Founder, Vendor Coordinator

Vicki Oppenheim, Planner, Secretary, Coordinator
story_txt:
Who We AreIn 2010, we launched the first year of the Denton Community Market. Our humble beginnings were in a parking lot only once a month. Since then we have grown to an every Saturday market in a historic park with over 70 members who grow, make and create things that are important to them.As we embark on our fifth market season in 2014, we have set very high hopes and goals to grow the market and the reach it has in our region. We are at a turning point, and we need training to get to that important next step.The workshop: "How to Create Successful Markets" from the Project for Public Spaces will show us what other market's have done and give us the information we need to move forward.With your help, we can receive the training we need that will propel the Market into a transformative fifth season and will provide us with tools we need to have a solid foundation for the future.What We NeedThe "How to Create Successful Markets" trip fees: 
Conference Fees for 2 People: $1100.00
Meals for 2 People for 4 Days: $400.00
Travel Costs for Taxi and Subway: $200.00
Indiegogo + Prize Costs: $600.00
Total Trip + Fundraising Cost: $2300.00

Free Flights for 2 People: $0.00
Free New York Stay for 3 Nights: $0.00
What You GetFor your support and contributions we have lots of wonderful prizes that include gift baskets of produce and handmade items from our vendors, a special invitation to the community workshop where we share what we learned from the training with you and a handmade market mug with your name on it, thanking you for your contribution! Any funds raised over our goal will go toward the market operations for 2014. The ImpactThe Denton Community Market is a pioneering organization in Denton. Our commitment to local and organic food, local handmade items and sustainable practices position us a unique market in the region. You can support the growth of the Market and the increase the access of local organic food and locally-created handmade items for the residents of Denton and beyond.Other Ways You Can HelpMaybe you can’t contribute funding today, but you can still help! 
Share the Indiegogo link on your personal and business Facebook pages
Use the Indiegogo share tools to increase our ranking on Indiegogo
Come out the Market and join our community
Thank you so much for your trust and support!In Community, Kati Trice & Vicki Oppenheim-------Kati Trice, Founder, Vendor CoordinatorVicki Oppenheim, Planner, Secretary, Coordinator

story:
UPDATE: 01/10/13 - PLEASE DO NOT CONTRIBUTE
Unfortunately, due to issues with the space outside of our control, we can no longer run this campaign at the moment. We hope to have a new space up and running soon, and you will all be invited along. In the meantime, thank you so much for all your support. Anyone who has contributed will be refunded shortly. 

DNA is a new community multi-platform venue within the city centre of Glasgow. We recently opened a building that had been sitting empty for 15 years, and over the past few months have been using it to create an inclusive community space for the people of Glasgow. A place to connect, to create and share.

Why we need your help:

We wanted to reclaim a space to really support the people of Glasgow. Over the last few months we've managed to have some really great projects including a national campaign that supported young creatives, pop up art galleries, gourmet insect pop up restaurants (you read that right the first time!) fashion pop ups and new business networking evenings on no budget. Thanks to volunteers and the support of the local community we've been able to begin to turn the space from an abandoned building site in to a functional community space.

However to refurbish the space and open other rooms in the venue, we need your support to help create a sustainable cultural hub within the city centre. We want to make sure that there is somewhere the people of Glasgow have real ownership of and really connect with the venue.

With your help we'll be able to stay open – continuing to support interesting local projects as well as open more rooms for people to use. We want to be a key space as part of Glasgow's cultural landscape.

Pennies and Pounds:

DNA is looking to raise £10,000 to keep our space open and refurbish and open new spaces within the venue.

With your donations we'll be able to make DNA bigger and better than ever before. DNA worked with some brilliant young creatives to begin restoring the space over the Summer but there is still lots more we want to do!

We have opened only a small part of DNA available for use and we want to make sure that we can make it the best place possible.


Share, connect and spread:

With your support we can really open up what DNA is and create a new community creative space in the city centre of Glasgow. Fancy helping us out?

  • Share, share, share. Facebook, twitter, pinterest – what ever. Let the people know! We are shouting from our proverbial rooftops about this campaign and we'd love for you to join us in speading the word.

  • Volunteer. Got spare time and a skill? If you want to help us continue developing the space we are always looking for extra hands to muck in around the space.

  • Pop along to our events, see what we're about and come be part of the DNA community!


So give what ever you can, share with your friends, family, people on the streets and together we can help create a creative community hub we can all be proud of.

story:
The Fat Trainer

The name pretty much says it all. Or does it?

About The Fat Trainer:

I came up with that name in 2007 after struggling with losing weight. I was close to 270 pounds and miserable. I began learning how to change my body and through the course of my studies, I became a Personal Trainer.

I couldn’t call myself something like Fit and Fab because I was well over 200 pounds. Who would take me seriously?

As it turns out, my client base exploded right away. People could relate to someone large. They felt at ease and were more able to commit to working out.

My awards range from local to national. I have met the likes of Soledad O'Brien, Simon Cowell, Randy Jackson, Tanya Tucker (I bought her lunch in Venice Beach one afternoon), Leslie Jordan (I bought his breakfast at the Griddle in LA one late morning) and others.

Think about your gym. If you weighed 50, 75 or 100+ pounds more than you do right now, would THAT be the place you would want to go to and get help? A nice body doesn’t make a nice person. I know many trainers who are jerks. The Fat Trainer isn’t a place for them. It’s a place for you!

Why should you help The Fat Trainer?

We are trying to do good things in the world. We want to help those that feel they have no hope and no sense of belonging. We offer reduced prices and free programs several times a year for those that may not otherwise be able to afford training. Your funding will help us purchase equipment enabling us to use our current resources for helping those individuals make the leap to a happier and healthy life!

Our company is well established and we have a very loyal client base. The space is ready to go, we just need to fill it with the equipment our clients need to make that big lifestyle change. Check out our website. You can see the before and after photos of just a few of the many people that have participated in the program. They are real people who did what we asked and got results. There is no disclaimer that the results are not typical. These people had typical results, just like countless others. Our program works and we want to reach more people. YOU can help us! Check out our pictures and watch some of the progress of Studio 360° that YOU are helping make possible!

We can reach out to those that feel intimidated by the big box gyms. We can make them comfortable. We have clients that have been with us from the beginning. We leave no one behind!

Picture the largest person you know. It could be a relative, friend or co-worker. They likely feel bad about themselves on a daily basis but are stuck in the same rut I was. I felt bad which made me eat more. I ate more and gained more weight. I gained more weight and felt worse about myself. THIS is exactly what sets me apart from the other gyms in my area - and probably yours. I have been through the transformation process and I know EXACTLY how each and every single person walking through the door feels. Because of that, my clients trust me and know the advice I am giving them, the instruction I provide is solid and real.

We have established clients and referral clients ready to go. We just need YOUR help getting the equipment for them!

What I need is

Funding is budgeted for training equipment and supplies. Things like a treadmill and mats, dumbbells and resistance bands go a long way in what we do!

The Impact

Countless people that won't go to a gym will go now. They will have a home with people that understand the emotional, mental and physical aspects of losing weight. These people are crazy loyal and we repay that by being crazy(er) loyal to them!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are only able to donate $1, $5 - it ALL helps! PayPal is accepted. Thank you for helping out!

story:
MEET DAVE GOLDMAN AND DISCOVER THE FAIR PARTNERSHIP MODEL 

making a difference one person at a time

I founded Atacora in 2009, however the concept began long before that, when I served in the Peace Corps in Boukombé, Benin, in the beautiful Atacora Mountains, from 1992-1995. I learned much about the region's flora and culture, and planted tens of thousands of trees with rural participants. I also saw the failure of foreign aid model to create sustainable community development. The wealth of resources; human and natural, which are abundantly available, had never yielded much in the way of economic benefit to the communities. Overexploitation of resources and depressed markets and wages continue to allow poverty and social inequality to reign.

After earning a Master's degree from Antioch University Seattle focusing on social change and sustainable development, I returned to Benin in 2007, and began to drum up an idea. With people I had known and worked with many years earlier, I helped design a strategy to revalue indigenous resources, promote sustainable resource use, and adhere to Fair Trade principles to promote gender equality and healthy local economy. In 2009, we began assembling our producer co-op and supply chain, constructed our facility; and in January of 2010, began production. It is clear that women can be a powerful engine for development. Thus, our 30+ member Fair Partnership Women's Producer Co-op is the heart and soul of our operation.

This mission has taken over my very being to its core, and brought great meaning and fulfillment to my life.

OUR PROJECT

Our partners in Benin, West Africa who sell us Baobab Fruit and Neem Seeds, and the 30+ women in our Fair Partnership Co-op have gained a significant income boost by working with Atacora.  This provides families with improved access to education (especially the girls!), health care services and improved nutrition.

We have worked very hard to open access to global markets for these valuable natural products in order to create more employment for women and bring African health traditions to the world.  The market is  responding very positively!  In order to respond to customers' needs, we need to increase production, and add the important values of Organic certification and thorough laboratory analysis of our products.  These upgrades to the operation require a significant up-front investment, and that is precisely why we are starting an Indiegogo campaign.

This is a deeply personal mission for me.  I served in the Peace Corps in the tiny villages where Atacora operates today more than 20 years ago.  Atacora is built on those relationships.  We are partners.  We are family.  My partners and I recognize that despite abundant natural and human resources in the area, poverty's grip remains unrelenting.  We concluded that opening market access could:

  1. Help build a sustainable local economy. 
  2. Promote social justice. 
  3. Improve environmental stewardship. 
  4. Create more employment for women.

We know that women are the very heart and soul of that effort.  We built our very small, rural production facility with our own hands on family land, planting thousands of trees and medicinal plants on the grounds.

WE NEED TO EXPAND AND OFFER MORE EMPLOYMENT TO SMALL ISOLATED VILLAGES IN WEST AFRICA

Baobab is really taking off in the global natural foods marketplace!  People want more than we can currently produce.  We really need to expand our storage and work area by putting up a simple but solid building.  More production would create more employment and expand the market for raw materials in our region.  Cement, roofing, doors and windows and labor are all costly.

Serious and enduring clients demand added value to products.  Organic Certification is a crucial element to market appeal.  Thorough scientific testing for all of our products is a requirement for export, import and quality assurance.  All this represents alot of up-front cost. 

WHAT REALLY DISTINGUISHES ATACORA?

There are other suppliers of Baobab and other African botanicals and crafts.  Unlike the rest, we do not simply identify producer communities and begin doing business as an intermediary to the global market.  Atacora is a vital member of this community. It is very much a family affair.  Atacora was conceived in collaboration with our community to create a win-win situation.  We must be incredibly sensitive to the needs of the community to maintain our integrity and be able to move forward.  This is the essence of Fair Partnership, and truly sets us apart.

Get over these initial hurdles and lock down a greatly expanded market, Atacora as a company, and agent of sustainable socio-economic improvement will grow and grow and grow!  

We invite all of you to join us as partners on this crucial mission.

BREAKDOWN OF COST

  • Building Expanded Workspace. Poor road infrastructure, difficulties procuring materials, and faulty workmanship can be real problems in this very rural area. LUCKILY, our Partner, Abel Adjé, who has helped us from the very beginning, owns a small construction business, and has built schools, homes and offices. He has a skilled team of craftsmen, and even a dump truck! We have broken the cost of this part of the project down to $32,500.
  • Organic Certification. Establishing a certified production system is a very detailed and complicated endeavor; involving every aspect of the whole system. Our Executive Director, Jacob, and Advisor, Abel, have successfully completed a comprehensive Ecocert training seminar. The have thorough knowledge of protocol and standards, and have built relationships with the Ecocert team in West Africa. Our documentation is already ready to go! We have identified the cost of this part of the project to be $15,000.
  • Laboratory Analysis. Knowing what customers want to see in terms of Certificates of Analysis can be challenging. So can identifying a lab with great professionalism. I have surveyed current clients and associates in the industry, and have a good grasp on what tests to order for each type of product. Having worked with Alkemists Labs last year to great satisfaction, I think we have it covered in the US. I recently identified an accredited lab in Benin as well, and have already established a relationship with their director. We have calculated the cost of this part of the project at $10,000.
  • Project Administration and logistics. $4,600
