story:
Our Story

1-for-1 Foods is the first certified 1 For 1 food company.

Meaning, we donate an equal and exact amount of food that you purchase. 

We're here because the only thing better than donating money to starving people....is donating food.

Our premier product is a granola bar that is originally formed into a circle, and then it’s cut directly in half. And when you buy one, literally the other half is given to a starving person. 1-For-1

How it works

  1. You purchase a 1-For-1 Food granola bar.
  2. The same amount is given to a starving person in an American food pantry or shelter.

It's that simple! But... we can't do it with out you...

We've fed thousands across America, and with your help today, we can begin to feed millions.

Our Product

About

  • Only certified 1-For-1 Food product.
  • Delicious, satisfying taste and texture.
  • Healthy, 26 vitamins and minerals
  • Made with organic and vegan ingredients
  • Attractive and recyclable packaging
  • Lasting shelf life

Flavors

Cranberry Almond, Apricot Walnut, Peanut Butter Cup (not shown), Cinnamon Apple (not shown)

Our Promise

To Everybody

For every one you purchase, literally, an exact amount is given to a starving person.

100% money back guarantee if you’re not completely satisfied.

Exceptional customer service.

Exclusive voting rights on our next products and flavors.

To Retailers

Window cling-on sticker, letting customers know, you carry 1-For-1 Food products. (left)

Attractive display Case-showing cause related material, signifying the local food pantry you’re supporting. (right)

Your store on our site, sending customers to your location.


To Fundraisers

Easy to hold, strong carrying case for easy door-to-door sales.

Fundraising materials and ordering forms for excess orders.

**Please enter “retailer” or “fundraiser” for orders $90 and above.

 

FAQS

Why Pre-sales?

With the orders we receive, it allows us to place bulk orders of packaging, ingredients, and manufacturing capabilities. This is necessary for the business model to function.

What happens after I place an order?

Once we receive all orders, we will manufacture a given amount of products. They are then shipped directly to you at no additional cost. The other halves are then sent to a food pantry in the given city which the orders were placed.

We document each delivery, so you know exactly where your “other half” is going.

What is Love Crunch?

Love Crunch is the former name of our original product. As we diversify, 1-For-1 Foods is more descriptive of our work!

Does 1-For-1 Foods offer international shipping?

Yes, we do offer international shipping. Costs vary depending on where you're located. Please message us for details at products@1for1food.com

What ‘s next?

With every order, you get exclusive voting rights for our next product and flavors.

Later, we’ll move into other products such as crackers, cereals, juice boxes, and other shelf stable health foods.

This will create a sustainable food program for assistance in America. Once this is accomplished, we’ll focus our attention towards a global market.

Bite into a revolution!

Please tell your friends and family!

Thank you very much!
story_txt:
Our Story
1-for-1 Foods is the first certified 1 For 1 food company.
Meaning, we donate an equal and exact amount of food that you purchase. 
We're here because the only thing better than donating money to starving people....is donating food.

Our premier product is a granola bar that is originally formed into a circle, and then it’s cut directly in half. And when you buy one, literally the other half is given to a starving person. 1-For-1
How it works

You purchase a 1-For-1 Food granola bar.
The same amount is given to a starving person in an American food pantry or shelter.
It's that simple! But... we can't do it with out you...
We've fed thousands across America, and with your help today, we can begin to feed millions.

Our Product
About

Only certified 1-For-1 Food product.
Delicious, satisfying taste and texture.
Healthy, 26 vitamins and minerals
Made with organic and vegan ingredients
Attractive and recyclable packaging
Lasting shelf life
Flavors
Cranberry Almond, Apricot Walnut, Peanut Butter Cup (not shown), Cinnamon Apple (not shown)

Our Promise
To Everybody
For every one you purchase, literally, an exact amount is given to a starving person.
100% money back guarantee if you’re not completely satisfied.
Exceptional customer service.
Exclusive voting rights on our next products and flavors.
To Retailers

Window cling-on sticker, letting customers know, you carry 1-For-1 Food products. (left)
Attractive display Case-showing cause related material, signifying the local food pantry you’re supporting. (right)
Your store on our site, sending customers to your location.

To Fundraisers

Easy to hold, strong carrying case for easy door-to-door sales.
Fundraising materials and ordering forms for excess orders.
**Please enter “retailer” or “fundraiser” for orders $90 and above.
 
FAQS
Why Pre-sales?
With the orders we receive, it allows us to place bulk orders of packaging, ingredients, and manufacturing capabilities. This is necessary for the business model to function.
What happens after I place an order?
Once we receive all orders, we will manufacture a given amount of products. They are then shipped directly to you at no additional cost. The other halves are then sent to a food pantry in the given city which the orders were placed.
We document each delivery, so you know exactly where your “other half” is going.
What is Love Crunch?
Love Crunch is the former name of our original product. As we diversify, 1-For-1 Foods is more descriptive of our work!
Does 1-For-1 Foods offer international shipping?
Yes, we do offer international shipping. Costs vary depending on where you're located. Please message us for details at products@1for1food.com
What ‘s next?
With every order, you get exclusive voting rights for our next product and flavors.
Later, we’ll move into other products such as crackers, cereals, juice boxes, and other shelf stable health foods.
This will create a sustainable food program for assistance in America. Once this is accomplished, we’ll focus our attention towards a global market.

Bite into a revolution!
Please tell your friends and family!
Thank you very much!

story:
Short Summary

This is about my sister Mary Lou Mendez-Bayram and her husband Ferhat Bayram...In January 2001 we had our lives forever changed...it's kind of weird what led up to Monday, January 22, 2001...it all started that previous Sunday, January 14...my dad had talked to Lulu on the phone, who was living in Turkey with Ferhat (they got married there in '97 and he was pursuing his PhD and she was a teacher at a private school) and Lulu had told Daddy that she was going to wire him some money...on Tuesday Daddy received that money and he began to call her...he didn't reach her and didn't think much of it...on Wednesday he still could not reach her...on Thursday my parents started getting worried...they talked to me about it...I was so busy with my life of course and I was like okay, I will email her..which I did..no response...on Friday mom was talking to my sister about not being able to reach Lulu and that she was concerned that something was wrong...they were in the living room...and my mom's walls are full of pictures of us from just about every age....as my mom stated that she was concerned about Lulu, her baby picture fell from the wall to the floor...my mom immediately started praying...(i have a lump in my throat as I write this-i have told this story a million times and it still gets me)....the weekend went by with no word from Lulu....on Monday morning my parents came to my apartment around 8:30 and I could see the look of worry/concern on their faces...my dad was trying to be more brave than what he looked...they said Harlingen Police had gone by the house to give them a message from the US Embassy but that they tried calling the number and the call was not going through...I called my contact at HPD and was able to track down the info...apparently my sister and Ferhat had been found unconscious in their aparment...I called my work at the time and told them that I was going to be late because I had to get some info on my sister first...I never in a million years thought that I would be on a plan to Turkey that afternoon with my mom...we didnt' have the money!...we also received calls from her friends who were able to get ahold of us...they told us 'they are alive, but someone really needs to be here'....we were advised by the US Department that they would provide us with emergency passports...I went to the airport in Harlingen and inquired about the flights...was advised that it would be $3000 each roundtrip...i advised it was an emergency and not pleasure...it was still going to be $1500 each...we still didn't have the money...but mom had just received a credit card and she did not hesitate to use it...I remember going into the federal building in Houston to await our passports and watching the tv...the Texas 7 had just been caught...as I waited I could see mom praying...she was always praying...but I didn't think that it was that bad...I just assumed we are going to go get Lulu and come back asap...never in a million years did I expect to find them both in comas...gosh, it is just so much to write and I just don't know where to start again....

We got to Ankara, Turkey....the school where my sister worked sent a van and some of her friends to come for us...and so the adventure began...Turkish, to English to Spanish, back to English, and Turkish...it was crazy....we finally met Ferhat's dad ...I still remember him carrying our luggage...and being told that Ferhat had sufferred 2 heart attacks already...

We get to the hospital...and when I say I was amazed...I was AMAZED at the number of people who were there...for Ferhat and Lulu!...it was so nice to have so many people there in support of them...as we walked further into the room we were introduced to Ferhat's mom...she immediately hugged my mom and both began crying and embracing each other...right there and then I realized that TEARS have no language...it is the same for everyone...after meeting everyone we were led to a break room where the doctors there met with us...we were told that they were unconcsious but they couldn't tell us why or what happened...they were both found in their apartment on their beds...and gashes on their legs...there was vomit to the side of my sister, on the floor...this is what i saw when i walked into their apartment...we were led in to go see them...they were in a room with others around...we were told that they were 'unconcsious' and they had not had a response from them...my mom walked up to Lulu and held her hand and started talking to her like when she was a baby...Lulu's hand squeezed my mom's!...that was the first sign of movement Lulu had made!...as I write this my tears are flowing...I just can't forget all this that easily...I walked up to Ferhat and started telling him that we were there and things would be okay...

That's when we were told that the last time anyone had seen them was Saturday, and they were not found until Monday morning...they went to her apartment because Lulu didn't show up to work, and that was unlike her...the landlady opened the apartment and that is when they found them and she screamed they were dead...one of Lulu and Ferhat's friends walked up to them and realized they were breathing even though their eyes had already rolled to the back of their heads...they called for an ambulance...their friends tried so hard to find out what happened...even taking a sandwich that was found in their room to see if that could be the issue....their cat Smokey was found alive...(Smokey is back home with Lulu!) ....you know the funny thing about this whole situation is that this was the first night they were spending in the apartment...they were going to be moving over the weekend so they could save money since this apartment was owned by the school my sister taught at...TED college I believe was the name...she was frugal and she wanted to save rent...

That Sunday Ferhat's brother in law got worried when they weren't at their old apartment to meet the movers...he did everything he could to locate them...even as far as going to Lulu's school and trying to get their new address-which they would not give him...I always wonder, what if, they had just given him the address or if they had even bothered to go check on them themselves if they would be okay now...the brother in law drove around for hours trying to locate them...but didn't find them...their friends assumed they were with his family even though the car was parked outside...just so many what if's....and the reason that daddy couldn't get a hold of Lulu was because she had disconnected the phone to have it transferred...

I know that i am leaving so many things out, but I just can't write everything...all I know is that this was an awful experience...and I wouldn't wish it upon anybody...after a week in a half we were advised that there was a medical plane that would come get us...and for this the US had approved that Ferhat come with us as a courtesy to Lulu since she was an American Citizen...Ferhat was a Turkish citizen and didn't have a visa or passport...but our hearts got heavy when the doctor advised us the Ferhat had suffered another heart attack and it would be too dangerous to have him fly back with us...let me tell you that when the medical personnel from the plane arrived, it was like a scene out of a movie...it was crazy...so, i took a couple of minutes to go see Ferhat and say my goodbyes...I walked over to him and held his hand...and I told him that I was taking Lulu with me and that I promised him that I would bring her back as soon as she got better...Ferhat had not regained consciousness...and he never did...6 months later on his 30th birthday, July 22, 2001, he passed...I cried so much...I got a call from his friend to tell me that he had passed...i had to let my parents know...but I couldn't say it to Lulu...so we kept it from her...

Mom and I didn't use our return tickets so I just assumed there would be a credit...so my sister and I drove to San Antonio so that I could get a flight back to Turkey to be with Ferhat's family...I still remember getting there to United and the counter was closed, but three employees were coming out and I begged them to help me...one walked straight out, and another male told the female employee to just leave me, to 'come on'....that female employee saw my hurt and desperation in me...I explained my brother in law had died and I needed to get back to Turkey...but even with the ticket credit, I still had to pay over $1000...which I didn't have...she stayed to help us, and the other two employees just left...I didn't get her name, but at least she tried to help me...I left the airport with a big heavy heart...and as of today, I have not been able to go back at all...

I never thougth that going back to Turkey would be to Ferhat's grave...Lulu's belongings are still in Turkey...I haven't been able to get them...especially her wedding dress, I wish I could go back ....

 

The reason for me asking for donations is that I have done what I can with fundraisers locally, and knowing about this I thought that I could help my family even more....see, my mom is 83 and my aunt is 65 and they both care for my sister 24/7...my mom has given up her life and has been taking care of Lulu since then...Daddy passed in June 3, 2003 and he died never knowing what happened to Lulu...

I want to be able to use this money to help my mom with a new bathroom and to put a dryer in the home...(they still use a clothesline)...and my mom is up in age and I want to be able to send her to see her family in Mexico before she is unable to travel...but we need help in getting someone to come and help with my sister for a while...she does get a provider for 4 hours a day...but that is not enough for Lulu, she needs constant care...I just want to give my mom and aunt a break...it will be tough having them take a break, but that is the least that I can do for them...

I have tried contacting news outlets to no avail...so, my last hope is with you...anything that you can help out with will be greatly appreciated...my mom and aunt more than anybody else know what Lulu needs...they will in turn say that they themselved don't need anything...just so you know that I am being honest, I will provide you with my sister's info:

Herminia J. Mendez, Mom 1513 Findley St., Harlingen, TX 78550 956.428.0130, be warned mom only speaks spanish...

Believe me when I say that anything that you can help out with will help my family in Harlingen...I thank you in advance...and if you want to ask me anything, please don't hesitate to contact me.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this page with others...I understand if you cannot donate, but by sharing this page with others is what I need also...again, thank you so much and God bless...

story:
Our Intention

We don’t need to tell you that East Side Yoga is a pretty special yoga studio.  As a student, teacher or friend of ESY, you already know that.  It’s the beautiful and peaceful space, amazing staff, awesome classes, workshops and special programs (many of them free), and just fact that the owners know you by name.  You feel the love and intention that Steven and Elsa have devoted to giving everyone who walks in the door the best yoga experience they possibly can.  How lucky we are to be a part of this community!

We, the students, teachers and friends of Eastside, are having this fundraiser in order to give back to are beloved studio. ESY has developed into a wonderful community in just over 2 years, and now it is time to help ESY get more eco-friendly, organized and cost-effective.  We all want ESY to thrive and grow for many years to come!

 

Our Goals

As soon as you walk in the door at ESY, you feel Steven and Elsa's vision and commitment.  Eastside Yoga offers us all a place to grow, experience and work towards reaching our full potential through self-discovery, practice, and study. We want ESY to reach it's fullest potential as well. We are passionate about what Eastside offers us and want to give back!  

The money we raise for Eastside will help the studio to be more eco-friendly, cost- effective and organized. The two main goals for this fundraiser are:

1. Insulate the studio. This will provide better sound-proofing and cut the cost of ESY's energy bills. ESY will use recycled denim for the insulation. This will create a more peaceful class environment while cutting down on resources to heat and cool the studio.

2. Build a stable reception desk that will help to make check-in and administrative work more organized and efficient. This will also be done with recycled materials. This will enhance the overall experience at ESY, from the moment you check in to the moment you leave the studio.

 

How You Can Help

If you share our love for ESY you can help us by contributing to our fund! Many of the teachers, students and friends have come together to offer various incentives. You can help ESY grow, and be recognized for your donation.  When the project is complete, all contributors will be invited to a gathering to celebrate.  If you have ever been to an ESY gathering, you know you do not want to miss it.  Please see the other incentives for donations at all levels.  Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Short Summary

This is Samer Bechara. My village consists of around 1,000 people. Only 100 of those people live in the village. Others are scattered around the globe, in countries such as Venezuela, Canada, Australia, USA...

In 2004, I created a website to connect those people. The website served the needs of everyone very well, but became very inactive after Facebook started getting popular in 2008. 

I have just relaunched a website for my village right now, which takes use of new technology as follows:

  • Website works equally well on mobile phones, tablets and computers.
  • Website has a professional look and feel, something which makes every member of the village real proud!

What We Need & What You Get

I need to get funding for $2,500 in order to do the following things:

  • Buy a Myheritage.com account ($160 per year): This account will be used to buy a subscription to grow the family tree on our website. I've already paid from my own money for the first year, but I need funding to renew the subscription. We now have 250 people in our tree and are still growing it. 
  • Live streaming of Mar Elias, Christmas and Easter mass: $1,000 ($500 laptop, $300 camera, $200 3G per year) : You will be able to watch these events live on the website, and watch a recorded version in case you're not available at that time
  • Live temperature from village: ($200 ) : You will be able to see on the website the temperature right now on in the village. 
  • Live pictures from village: ($100): I will setup a webcam which takes a picture and posts it to the website every minute. 
  • Ardrone 2.0: (Includes shipping and customs ($500) ) : This is a toy helicopter which contains an HD camera. I will be able to record videos of the village from an aerial view. It's just like having our own helicopter that we take photos from!
  • Automatically update family tree on website ($300 for programmer to implement): Currently every time changes are made to the family tree, we need to manually add them to the website. I want to make this process automatic. 

In case I receive additional funding, here is what I will use them for:

    • I will create a section about important figures in the village
    • I will create a section about OLD funny stories. I don't want to see those memories die, and neither anyone I suspect
    • I will find all the old videos of the village, and add them to the website as well. Some people have videos back from the 1980s and 1990s. That's 20 and 30 years old.
    • Print a huge family chart of the whole village , and display it in a public place at our village.

The Impact

We will be more connected. It's time for this village to reunite, and I think this website will help us all get around one good cuase. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you know people who can help us get funding, or help us with the website tasks, please let us know!

What We Need & What You Get
I need to get funding for $2,500 in order to do the following things:

Buy a Myheritage.com account ($160 per year): This account will be used to buy a subscription to grow the family tree on our website. I've already paid from my own money for the first year, but I need funding to renew the subscription. We now have 250 people in our tree and are still growing it. 
Live streaming of Mar Elias, Christmas and Easter mass: $1,000 ($500 laptop, $300 camera, $200 3G per year) : You will be able to watch these events live on the website, and watch a recorded version in case you're not available at that time
Live temperature from village: ($200 ) : You will be able to see on the website the temperature right now on in the village. 
Live pictures from village: ($100): I will setup a webcam which takes a picture and posts it to the website every minute. 
Ardrone 2.0: (Includes shipping and customs ($500) ) : This is a toy helicopter which contains an HD camera. I will be able to record videos of the village from an aerial view. It's just like having our own helicopter that we take photos from!
Automatically update family tree on website ($300 for programmer to implement): Currently every time changes are made to the family tree, we need to manually add them to the website. I want to make this process automatic. 

In case I receive additional funding, here is what I will use them for:

I will create a section about important figures in the village
I will create a section about OLD funny stories. I don't want to see those memories die, and neither anyone I suspect
I will find all the old videos of the village, and add them to the website as well. Some people have videos back from the 1980s and 1990s. That's 20 and 30 years old.
Print a huge family chart of the whole village , and display it in a public place at our village.




The Impact
We will be more connected. It's time for this village to reunite, and I think this website will help us all get around one good cuase. 



Other Ways You Can Help
If you know people who can help us get funding, or help us with the website tasks, please let us know!

story:
Alexandria Family Fun Day 5k: May 19, 2013

The RunningBrooke Community and the Alexandria Rotary engage and empower citizens near and far to "lace up their shoes" for at-risk kids in Northern Virginia and throughout the world! We make grants (100% of all donations and proceeds) to proven charities that help kids near and far live better lives.
 
Now it's your turn to jump in the game: help us to purchase race t-shirts and ensure that ALL of the race entry fee goes to children's charities! Your name and/or company logo can be printed on the shirt to show the community your support. (deadline: May 5)

About Alexandria Rotary: Rotary is an organization of business and professional leaders united worldwide, who provide humanitarian service, encourage high ethical standards in all vocations, and help build goodwill and peace in the world.

About RunningBrooke: She has skin in the game!

Phase 1: A marathon on each of the 7 continents, in each of the 50 states, and the 5 world marathon majors - over a marathon a month - DONE in October, 2013.

Phase 2: 100 marathons and one million dollars for at-risk NoVA kids. 

Join us and help kids, one step at a time!
http://alexandria5k.com

story:
What is Motivolog.com?

Hi! My name is Gökhan Sezginer and I am co-founder of Motivolog.com. I am a Biomedical Engineer and have MSc. degree in Medical Informatics.

4 years ago I was diagnosed for a chronic illness and after my doctor visit I started to Google it. During my research I have realized that there were lots of patient blogs which were sharing their experiences about that disease but they were in English. At that time there were no platforms for patients in Turkish so I started to think about creating a patient network to help patients whose native language is Turkish.

I have quit my job last summer, which I was working for 4 years, and started to work on Motivolog.com. 3 months ago we have launched the network. The initial impact was great from the Turkish patient community. 

Right now at Motivolog.com,  we have 200 stories in 50 different disease groups and 500 users who are asking questions, answering questions or sharing their own stories everyday. Active users wise, we are growing 5-6% each week, without making any advertisement yet.

Our team is composed of 4 people. Haydar, at the left side of the photo, who is working as a co-founder of Motivolog, is a computer engineer, and responsible of coding. Merve and Bensu are our content editors and university students. Our team is 50% women, 50% men. - Unfortunately we couldn't share Merve and Bensu's photos because they are mobile working and they are now at their summer houses:) -

Currently, we are collaborating with patient associations to share our knowledge with them. These associations are focused on rare diseases and cancer.

In Turkey, it is not easy as it is in USA to find angel investors so we are currently working in an incubation center, without any income but with passion. In Turkey incubation centers don't provide you fund, they just give you office space to work in.

If we can reach our goal in here, we want to translate our patient stories to English, including the analysis of users stories, in order to share them with world-wide users. This content will include information such as drug side effects, different treatments that you haven't heard of, how people are motivating themselves to win their battle against that disease.

What We Need & What You Get

We need 15.000$ for growing Motivolog.com with new features, such as treatment scoring, treatment side effects, life quality graphs of patients and to make an English version of the website.

We don't have office expanses. We are working in an incubation center and anywhere with internet connection could be an office for us. So all the money that we raised will be used for the project and to make advertisements in order to increase our members for sharing their stories.

For your donations we will be creating a disease group that you want us to focus on, send you Motivolog bike jersey, and Motivolog sweatshirt or t-shirt.

If we can't reach our goal, we still be working on Motivolog.com. Not being able to reach our goal is not going to change our passion, we will be still looking for opportunities to create fund for us. 

The Impact

A patient revolution has been started within the last years. Patients started to search about their own disease and they share their research with the doctors. Some specialists say that even doctors reads 2 journals about his area within every day, they still fall back in their area. Everyday lots of developments are being made in medical sector. You can learn for you treatment from another patient and share it with your doctor. It is very easy find out something about your possible treatment using the web, it doesn't matter which side of the world you live in.

Do you know that my treatment has been changed with a journal that I've found on a patient blog? Don't underestimate the power of the patient networks.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute by donating you can share this campaign on your Twitter or your Facebook account and spread it to your network.

story:
Unmolding & Cutting Soap


Bath Bomb Demo

Packaging Soap

Hi my name is Tiffany and I need your help!

My dream has always been to own my own business and with your help it can become a reality. 

  Mosaic Mimosa 




Here are a few things about the soap I make:

  • All of the soap I make are free of parabens 
  • High quality handmade soap 
  • Small batches so each soap received will be unique
  • Custom Orders ( weddings, birthdays ect... )
  • Shea Butter, Coconut Oil, Vitamin E Oil for added moisture


Emerald Mimosa 


What We Need & What You Get

  • The money you donate will help me get supplies and equipment I need to take my soap making/business to the next level.  If I make my goal I will be adding even more things to my soap website for purchase, such as shower gels, candles, massage candles, solid shampoo bars, solid shaving bars, bath teas, bath bombs and more.
  • So whats in it for you???  If you donate you will receive special items, deals, and perks!  
  • If the entire goal is not reached I will still be adding more items to my site but it will be on a smaller scale

Double Orange Cupcake


Enchanted Dream

The Impact

  • In the future of this business I would love to donate bath and body products to those in need ( shelters, salvation, ect... ) 


Simple Pleasures


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to donate at this time you can help further this campaign by sharing this campaign with your friends and family.  

  • Please share this campaign with your friends and family using the share tools 
  • Like me on Facebook - Facebook.com/naturalsoapco
  • Follow me on Instagram - @naturalsoapco

story:
Our Mission

Healthy parental connections are essential to a child's development. Children are the silent victims of their parent's crime through the trauma and loss of the environment that has been their life. When a child's parent is incarcerated and a healthy connection is maintained, it reduces the child's risk for social, emotional, and educational problems. For the incarcerated parent, family connection decreases the likelihood of recidivism. Maintaining and enhancing the bond between the child and the incarcerated parent through video messages and other interactive media are the focal points of The Messages Project.
 
Since 1999, the Messages Project has visited state prisons across the United States several times a year to create more than 9,000 messages (videotapes or DVDs) from incarcerated parents to their kids. The recordings are mailed home to children and families, often with a book that was read as part of the message.

How You Can Help

With the help of the Jacaranda Foundation and School for Orphans in Malawi, The Messages Project is going international for the first time in August! By expanding our program to assist children of incarcerated parents in Africa, we hope to bring further awareness to the global issue of the children left behind when a parent is imprisoned.
 
But we need your help! The cost to produce the average message is about $15 (for materials and postage). Our trip to Malawi will incur additional costs, including travel expenses and compensating for the scarcity of power sources. To make our trip as successful as possible, we need to ensure we have enough volunteers onsite and enough materials to help as many children as possible.

We Make a Difference

Our organization has been proven to enhance the lives of children affected by parental incarceration. These kids are less likely to later become involved in the criminal justice system themselves, and their parents are less likely to reoffend after their release from prison. We've received numerous compliments from participants, such as the following.
 
“I am 17-years-old and when my dad went to prison, I was sad and depressed. I haven’t seen him in a long time. When the DVD message and book arrived, I was emotional, but happy that I could see my dad. It felt like we were in the same room together. I really value the fact that I was able to see my dad and know he is okay and thinking about me daily. He looked good and I was able to see that myself. This is a great program!”
~A Message Recipient

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to make a monetary donation at this time, that's okay! Please help support our cause by following us on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, YouTube, and LinkedIn. Use the Indiegogo "share" tools to spread the word about our fundraiser, and let us know if you're available to volunteer at filmings in your state. See our site for complete details.

story:
Our Bridge

  • Brown Truss Type Covered Bridge.
  • Built in 1867
  • Was the oldest operational covered bridge in Michigan that still carried vehicle traffic.
  • Destroyed by arson on July 7, 2013.
  • 100% Disabled Veteran leading rebuilding effort.

Who We Are

Whites Covered Bridge stood for over 146 years, providing a vital transportation link, a picturesque setting, and great historical value to Ionia County, Michigan. On July 7, 2013 the bridge was destroyed by arson. At that time, the bridge was the oldest covered bridge in use in Michigan.

Within days, our group, Friends Rebuilding Whites Bridge was formed to make sure that our covered bridge gets rebuilt. What started as a group of strangers has evolved into a group of friends with the common goal of seeing this bridge rebuilt.

Our group came out swinging and quickly got Governor Rick Snyder, the Ionia County Road Commission and the township that the bridge stood in our our side as partners in the rebuilding effort. We also acted quickly as a group and organized a recovery effort of the remains of the old bridge using volunteer labor and machinery along with donated fuel for the excavator and trucks, and removed the remains from the river not only stopping the debris from further polluting the river, but saving the taxpayers of Ionia County, Michigan over $40,000.00. Without our intervention, the debris would still be in the river because the county did not have the money to remove it.

What It Will Cost

Bridges aren't Cheap! The estimated cost to build a replica bridge is in the neighborhood of $350,000-$450,000.00 down from the intial estimate from the county, which includes the cost of all materials and labor. This cost estimate was derived from the Project Engineer who rebuilt the Ada, Michigan covered bridge that was destroyed by fire in 1979. He has come on board with us and has been instrumental in furthering our cause, he also brings experience that few people will ever possess, the experience of already rebuilding a covered bridge.

We have partnered with the Fallasberg Historical Society, who now has the oldest covered bridge in Michigan open for traffic, to be our Fiscal Sponsor. Their beautiful covered is located just a few miles upstream from where Whites Bridge stood so they have a vetted interest in our effort. They will maintain all the funds raised through this campaign and when we have raised the money, they will turn the money over to Keene Township so that they can enter into a contract with the county to replace the bridge.

All money raised for the rebuilding of the bridge will go for just that, the rebuilding. If for some reason the bridge can't be rebuilt, the money will stay with Keene Township who will use the money to fund programs for the citizens of the township.

  Why Should You Donate to Us

Covered bridges are cool. No, really, you should contribute because this bridge has impacts outside of the local area. Whites Bridge is a popular spot for photos; it is part of covered bridge tours, and bicycle tour routes. The bridge also held a lot of history, it was a place where you could go and actually see and feel the spot where your long deceased relatives signed their names. I know my Great Grandparents, Grandparents, Mother, Father and myself and my children all signed our names in the old bridge and even though we lost history in the old bridge, the new one will be a clean slate for the current and future generations to sign.

Although 146 years of history have been destroyed, it is not forgotten and rebuilding the bridge will keep the person who burned it down the satisfaction of knowing that they succeeded. They will see that in the end that the "Phoenix" will rise and that good always trumps evil.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Eric Shepherd and I am a student of the sarangi player Zohaib Hassan.  Along with fellow students, I'm looking to raise money and awareness about Zohaib Hassan's recent housing situation.

Recently Zohaib and his family were unfairly kicked out of their own home by their landlord who does not tolerate music. The landlord also kept raising the rent until finally kicking them out. This campaign is dedicated to help Zohaib and his family afford a home in a different neighborhood where he can be free to practice, perform, and teach sarangi.  Zohaib Hassan is one of the most kind, humble people I know, this should not be happening to him. Right now Zohaib and his family are temporarily staying with a family member, but it's a situation that's not at all practical, and can't last long.

By contributing to this campaign you will allow Zohaib to afford to move to a safe area where he can make a safe and decent living as a musician, in doing so you'll be helping to keep alive Zohaib's musical family tradition of 5 generations. This is a very valuable part of Pakistan's musical cultural heritage.  Contributors are directly involved in preserving this heritage for generations to come. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise at least $2700 that will go to Zohaib Hassan so that he and his family can lease a house where he can practice sarangi and also teach students online without being persecuted and discriminated against. The cost of a 3-5 year lease in a decent neighborhood in or near Lahore Pakistan would cost Zohaib about $5000 total, and we have already gathered $2500 on our own, but we need the public's help to reach our final goal plus campaign fees.  

Perks range from a thank you from Zohaib, to you, the donor deciding one of the pieces of music to be recorded on his upcoming solo sarangi CD/download release.

If the entire goal is not reached then any portion gathered will go to Zohaib and his family and saved for when they finally have enough money to buy a 3-5 year home lease.  

The Impact

This fundraiser is important because it allows Zohaib to carry on his family's unique musical tradition. Getting the help he needs will greatly impact his life, Zohiab had polio when he was 4 years old, as a result he was left partially paralyzed, so music is Zohaib's life, he used to practice sarangi for over 8 hours a day before his landlord forbade it, being able to move into a stable housing situation will give Zohaib the chance to be the best he can be. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help 

If you can't contribute money, then another great way to help Zohaib is to spread the word by sharing this link with all of your friends. Any help is greatly appreciated.

 

More info

If you have any questions, or would like more information email David Berner at noisysarangi@yahoo.com. Thank you. 

Zohaib Hassan's Contact info: 

Location: Lahore, Pakistan

Email: zohaibhassan.zebi@gmail.com

Cell: +92-301-4572871

Skype:  zohaib.zebi1

story:
Soap for Hope: Grief Relief Project

There's not much that can compare the depth of pain one feels after the unexpected death of a love one. It's a pain I've witness paralyze family and friends time and time again while working as a Police Sergent and Ordained Minister for the last 30 years. Now I've retired from police work, I'm still affected by the numerous funeral donation car washes many families are forced to do to raise money for the unexpected burial of an infant/child, a young teen or a poor mother.

Out of wanting to do something to contribute to these families, an idea came to me to get communities involved and support families during these tragic times. I am a leader in an organization called Just Cause Fundraising (JustCauseFundraising.com). We provide Premium Laundry Detergents to be sold by non-profits, schools, churches etc., to raise money for their just cause purposes. My idea is to begin an ongoing fundraiser initiated by the indiegogo community and supported by the local communities to help families with funeral expenses. Hence, Soap for Hope: Grief Relief Project.

We will provide our Rain cycle Premium Laundry Detergent for purchase by the community with all proceeds being given to families conducting funeral donation car washes. Can you imagine the spiritual uplift the families will experience after receiving $100-$500 car wash donation.

What You Give and What you Will Receive

We are in need of the funds to kick start our Grief Relief Project in both Phoenix, Arizona and Indianapolis, Indiana. We will purchase 2 pallets (160 units) of our Rain Cycle Laundry Detergent (Specially labeled Soap for Hope). Once we receive the units, we will announce our campaign through social media and community newspaper and radio encouraging people to purchase the laundry Detergent to contribute to families conducting funeral donation car washes. Once again, all proceeds will go to the needy families and we will restock for continual operation. Our goal is to get communities everywhere involved.

Besides the heart warming feeling you will have knowing that you are affecting the lives of various families, I have listed some perks that I feel will keep you close to the vibrations of our efforts.

The Impact

Although we will not be able to fully fund funerals, our collective assistance to the families will be received with tremendous grace and many spirits will be uplifted during these tragic moments. Hopefully with our gift, we will be able to convince assisted families to help the next family in need within the community.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help get the word out by "Liking us" on Facebook (facebook.com/JustCauseFundraising) where we will be talking a lot about this campaign and thanking each contributor. Also share what you have read here. Make use of the indiegogo tools. Thanks you for your interest!

story:
My name is Brigitte Lewis, and Spirit Bridge is a company I founded to help marginalized communities find their core strength.  By doing this, each community (whether it be geographic or organizational) can build, fight, and grow in a sustainable, self-sufficient way.

I have worked in a wide range of industries and settings.  Legal/Governance, Labour/Union, Finance/Insurance, Oil/Fossil Fuel, and (most recently) Federal Government.  My formal education has been in the areas of  Natural Science, Engineering and Economics.  My informal education reflects a similarly wide range of subject areas to my career path to-date.

Early in 2013 I voluntarily left the Federal Government to take a more hands-on approach to community development.  The constraints of public service, and politics, were preventing what I saw as necessary, urgent action to make this country a safe, prosperous (and most importantly) respectful place to live.

I try to provide free services to any community or not-for-profit in need.  Unfortunately I don't have the means to provide free services where travel is required.  I have to ask communities to pay for my transportation.  I am always willing to minimize costs by couch-surfing, pitching a tent, or staying at the least expensive commercial accommodations available.  Even this, however, is often cost-prohibitive for the communities most in need.

The most vulnerable communities are often the same ones on the front line of controversial natural resource extraction projects, and other threats to North American land and waters.  Helping them build their strength to facilitate meaningful, informed negotiation and discussion, is vital for the health and well being of our economy and all people.

What We Need & What You Get

What I am asking for here, is funding to provide strength-based development services to four communities most in need of assistance, in places I have to travel to get to.  Including flight, accommodations, and materials, each activity would cost roughly $2,500.  (4x$2,500 = $10,000)

What you get:

a $10 contribution will get you an exclusive photo from the community activity (the photo will be yours alone, and will not be among those shared on our website or through social media)

Contributions of $25 or more will also receive a custom made (handmade) iPad/tablet sleeve (see campaign photos for examples).  Contact me with any colour preference.

a $25 contribution will get you the exclusive photo, and a first-hand account of the activity (likewise, exclusive to you only and not otherwise shared).

a $50 contribution will get you the photo, first-hand account, and the opportunity to nominate a community/organization for consideration as one of the four

a $100 contribution will get you the photo, first-hand account, nomination and the opportunity to review and provide feedback on the short-list of potential communities/organizations

a $500 contribution will get you the photo, first-hand account, nomination, review/feedback opportunity as well as recognition on-site (signage, mention in the materials) and in all website or social media sharing of activity information before and after the activity.

The Impact

As a project funder/facilitator with the Federal Government, I was witness to so many instances of short-sighted consulting and project development among marginalized communities.

Consultants, collecting huge fees, doing borderline work and leaving the community no better off, with plans and commitments that were unsustainable without further reliance on outside sources of services and funding.

Spirit Bridge is different.  It is different by design.  Our work balances consultation with training so that when we are done, the community/organization is left with skills, strength, and strategies that they need to continue to build on without us (or anyone else).  Self-reliance is the answer.  Strength is the instrument of positive change.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share the information about our work with your friends, colleagues and business network.  Tell them what we are trying to accomplish, and let them know we can help ANY group address ANY challenges with strength and self-sufficiency.

Our services are as effective to improving the bottom line of a business, as they are to improving outcomes for marginalized communities.  Another way you can help is by hiring us for your group.  You'll get the benefit of our services, and a portion of our fee always goes to funding our free endeavours for those who are unable to pay.

Our Bottom Line

Any money raised, even if we don't reach our goal, will go directly toward providing services to marginalized communities.  If we can't travel to reach them, we'll work in our own area to bring strength-based positive change to those who most need it.  Every dollar will count.  Every dollar will make a difference.

Thank you.

Brigitte

story:
Hello, my name is Kelvin Brown, and I own and operate Muskogee Directory.

You may not know me but if you live in Muskogee, it is highly likely that you have seen my work.  Primarily, I promote Muskogee, through pictures, using several different media channels, including MuskogeeDirectory.com, as well as social media sites; Facebook, Twitter, Youtube and others.  Also, for the last few months, through a weekly section in the Muskogee Phoenix, called Around Town, which features 20 to 30 pictures that I take at varying events around the city.

As the name suggest, Muskogee Directory, is a directory listing hundreds of businesses in the Muskogee area.  Listing everything from places to eat, sleep and play to large and small events.  This is an attempt to raise funds to take Muskogee Directory to the next level, in its ability to serve Muskogee.


STOP:  I have read enough, how can I help?

Just look at the perks on the right side and decide at what level you would like to participate. Then tell your friends.


I NEED MORE:  In that case continue reading.

Why have you been asked to visit this page? 

Because the world is going mobile, and Muskogee Directory has started to go mobile.

In August of 2012 I began researching what it would take to make information about the city of Muskogee mobile ready, and how to expand Muskogee Directory to accomplish this. 

Phase one,  was understanding the mobile market.

Phase two, was testing and consumer feedback.

Phase three, was getting the app accepted by Apple/Iphone and Google Android.


Where are we now?

The app has been approved; it is online and active on approximately 275 phones. With approximately, 300 business listing in the database.

The next step is phase four:  Depending on which sources you use, Muskogee, Oklahoma supports 1,200 to 1,400 businesses.  To make the app truly, a useful resource, then at least 90% of those businesses needs to be included in the app.  Each listing should carry a minimum of business name, address, and phone number.  With the exception of some home based business that would rather not give a home address.  Also the app will list a full and active events calendar.

The goal is to have the app fully ready to be useful for the 2013 holiday shopping season. Through the app some of the information shared will be, where the best deals are, holiday hours, and who has the last great Christmas gift in stock and more.


Now the problem or the issue before us.  Cost.  To get this done in the next 45 days is going to take time and money.  Both of which are in short supply. 

The goal of this fundraising quest is to raise $3,200.  This will cover the cost of a local contractor to expedite data entry, new equipment to take better pictures, and an upgrade to the mobile software. 


This is not charity: 

I am not a non-profit agency, so I am not just asking you to give for the sake of giving.  In the case of businesses that are looking for addition advertising, promotion and marketing, you can choose to participate at the business levels beginning at $100.


What do you get for $100?  Your plain listing which is free is upgraded to the first level, which includes your logo, website and social links.  This promotion is good through the end of 2014.  The normal cost would be over $300.  Plus, you get the benefit of being first in, which means your business gets addition exposure.

To the right of the page are the additional levels.

If you just like the services that Muskogee Directory provides and want to see it expand and offer more, your support would be greatly appreciated.  The consumer levels start at $1, just to be involved.  At $10, you get recognition on our virtual brick wall.  With $20, you get pictures of yourself or family that I may have taken over the last 4 years.

Over the next 4 weeks, this document will be updated, as well as more videos added to answer questions and keep you updated.

Thank you sincerely,

Kelvin Brown

CEO/Director

Muskogee Directory

story:
Short Summary

Read the full story here: Lookout for Lookout. 

Dear Poets,

For the last four years I have worked on and off for a Vancouver-based organization called Lookout Emergency Aid Society. 

Indulge me, poets. Please lend me a minute to tell you about their absolutely incredible work. 

Lookout started about 40 years ago, when a couple of socially minded folks began to notice the presence of adults on the streets and shores of our pretty city. People who had nowhere safe to lay their heads. We know now that there are thousands and thousands of people in Vancouver who - every single night - don’t have somewhere to call home. And we know that the number one cause of homelessness in our country is poverty and poverty alone. Lookout sees it constantly. Countless citizens - seniors, students, working people, families, as well as people who are struggling with their mental health, and folks who have found themselves in the grips of addiction - end up in situations where the cost of living outstrips their ability to pay for it. 

And on a more personal note, this is something that is not lost on musicians. I know no shortage of people who have encountered these difficult situations. But it’s not just relegated to the small-time: Kurt Cobain; Jim Morrison; Ella Fitzgerald; Jennifer Lopez; Jewel; Beck; Patti Smith; Shania Twain. The list is not short. People - wealthy people - that you encounter in popular culture every day - have struggled with homelessness in pursuit of their dreams. Illness, crumbling economies, addiction, and difficult times strike people of every social strata. In my work with Lookout I have met successful athletes, former millionaires, lawyers, Wall Street traders, incredibly talented musicians and poets; and hundreds of very, very normal people who have needed assistance. I have also met many people with stories from the other end of the spectrum. People who have encountered and survived situations that you and I couldn’t have lasted a week in: Abuse; injury; death of loved ones; manipulative landlords; family tragedy; and on and on. 

What We Need & What You Get

Let’s support them. Let’s provide a few bed nights. Let’s give just a couple of people who have done good - and people who will do good in the future - a few reasonably comfortable days to make it work. We all know what it is like when life gets hard. And we can all make a difference. You have until October 20th to chip in. 
Should you need prizes, they are as such:
Under $10
Thank you. I love you. You're wonderful. You are a kind soul, and I will send you download codes to any record of mine that you want. 
$10-20
Free download of any record, and you'll be on the guest list at the Oct. 11th and 17th shows. If you don't live in Vancouver, you'll be on the list the next time I come to your town. 
$20-50
All of the above, and I will deliver you (personally, if possible, otherwise via our friends at Canada Post) a first-glance copy of "Dear Poets - A Lyrical Notebook." It's a charming young notebook that mixes blank pages with pages from my own notebooks, and provides space for you and I to collaborate together. 
$50 and above
Downloads. Guest lists. Notebook.
And a brand new - never before made - DN Tank top. Printed on dark gray ethically made American Apparel Tri-blend fabric. 
Want to give more? 
I will give you more. Drop a line at davidnewberrymusic@gmail.com. I'll write you a song and sing it on youtube for $100. Play you a personal house concert for $500. 

The Impact

Help me help the helpers, poets. Every single day Lookout provides 591 permanent homes, 166 transitional suites, and 181 shelter beds. When it gets too cold they offer 77 more beds. And they cannot do it without the support of people like us. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Attend the shows!

    October 11th - Biltmore Cabaret - Vancouver, BC
    Doors 7:30pm (Curfew 11:00pm) - By Donation $5 - $20
    David Newberry, Dogwood and Dahlia, Corbin Murdoch (Nautical Miles) and Daniel Moir.
    Plus silent auction

    October 17th - Capilano University CSU Lounge - North Vancouver, BC
    Doors 1:00pm - Music until 5:00pm
    David Newberry, The Tourist Company, David P. Smith

story:
Let's Turn A Nightmare Into A Dream


On August 8, 2014 in Okeechobee, Florida, 16 year old Aaron Hill, who has been diagnosed with Autism Spectrum Disorder and other learning disabilities, was invited to a party.  Aaron had been to this home before and knew the family.  The two adults in the home bought alcohol for the teens.  After drinking whiskey Aaron felt ill and laid down on the floor.  He woke up when the group told him to go outside and fight Blake Campbell, 17, whose main intention of going to the party that evening was to fight with Aaron Hill.   Aaron refused to go outside and asked the people in the house to call his Mom but they did not do that!  18 yr. old Andrew Wheeler was then called into the house.  While Aaron was sitting on the floor, curled up, with his hands trying to protect his head Andrew Wheeler proceeded to beat Aaron while a friend videotaped the event on his phone.  The graphic, disturbing and horrifying video was uploaded to Facebook and has since gone viral!  Andrew Wheeler kneed Aaron Hill repeatedly in the face and head.  He pulled Aaron by his hair to the center of the floor and while pulling his hair he repeatedly punched him in the back of the head and neck.  After getting up from the floor,Aaron stumbled outside where Wheeler proceeded to choke him until he passed out.  Aaron woke up while being beaten by Wheeler as others stood around in a circle and laughed.  Wheeler held a knife to Aaron’s throat and told him he was going to kill him, he also punched him and kicked him repeatedly.  Aaron was able to get to the front door of the house and finally the adult stopped the fight but told him to leave, on his own, walking! Andrew Wheeler forced Aaron to start walking and he walked until he could walk no further and passed out in the middle of the road.    A woman driving by noticed a young man lying in the middle of the road and called 911.  She shone her lights on Aarons body so that no other vehicles would be able to hit him! The young woman reported that Aaron was coughing, crying, moaning and he was very scared!  Police and EMS arrived and took Aaron to the hospital.  Aaron sustained marks and bruising to his head, abdomen, chest and arms. He had a sprained neck, facial and scalp contusions and a concussion.  Not to mention the deep and lasting psychological damage that this has caused him.  The video of this beating  has gained worldwide attention because of the cruelty of the attack on this defenseless boy!  Andrew Wheeler, 18,  has been charged with aggravated child abuse and child abuse and Evadean Lyedecker, 40, one of the adults in the home, has also been charged with aggravated child abuse, child neglect, allowing an open house party in her home and contributing to the delinquency of a minor.   On September 18, 2014 three more arrests were made in this case.  Blake Campbell, 17, who videotaped the incident has been charged with principal to first-degree child abuse and cyberstalking/bullying.  Brandie Dailey, 16,  who invited Aaron to the party and called on Wheeler to get him out of the house by telling Wheeler that Aaron had pushed and hit Daileys  sister has been charged with principal to child abuse as she watched the attack and did not seek help.  Keith Carnley Sr., 42 has been charged with delinquency to a minor. 

 Aarons' family started ‘Justice For Aaron’ on the web and has held several rally’s for this cause.  Thousands of people as well as celebrities, Montel Williams (talk show host), Aaron Paul (Breaking Bad) and others have taken a strong role in this attack and are showing support and outrage.  Aaron Paul opened his house to Aaron and his family to get them away from it all and even offered a day at Disney World just to try to put a smile on this young man’s face.  Aaron has not been able to attend his local high school as the school district cannot provide protection to him from possible fallout from other friends of the attackers.  Several people have gotten together to help Aaron gain his smile back and what a beautiful smile it is!  They are reaching out to others to help along the way!  The Hill family now has a spokesperson that single-handedly gained Aarons' trust and is showing him that the World is a better place with him smiling again!  Three individuals worked hard together to gather funds to help Aaron and with a show of support from local businesses Aaron is on his way to recovery both mentally and emotionally.  However the Hill family is struggling with much more!

 Lesley Hill is a single Mom raising five children.  Two of them are on the Autism Spectrum Scale.  With one income and mouths to feed the bills have mounted up.  Thanks to the family spokesperson Aaron and his family now have internet and a home phone again so in the case of an emergency they can call for help!  We are asking all of those of you out there who can understand the frustration and pain that Bullying can cause not only to our children but to us as parents to please help us with our journey to fight the good fight against Bullying and for Aarons attacker and others responsible to be prosecuted to the fullest of the law!  Bullying needs to be stopped!  Perhaps Aaron Hill is the catalyst that will raise more awareness to Bullying and teach children that hurting others is not COOL!

We thank you for any donation that you are able to make whether it be big or small, to help the Hill family turn this nightmare into a dream!

Please feel free to donate at the PayPal account that is managed for the family by their spokesperson.  Any money that is donated will be used for the family's needs and for Aaron’s recovery and well-being.  There is also a P.O. Box that has been set up  for well-wishers to send  cards, or gifts etc.,. to Aaron or the Hill family!

Aaron Hill

P.O.Box 2723

Okeechobee, FL  34973  USA


 Thank you for the love.  'Justice For Aaron'

been diagnosed with Autism Spectrum Disorder and other learning disabilities,
was invited to a party.  Aaron had been
to this home before and knew the family. 
The two adults in the home bought alcohol for the teens.  After drinking whiskey Aaron felt ill and
laid down on the floor.  He woke up when
the group told him to go outside and fight Blake Campbell, 17, whose main intention of going to the party that evening was to fight with Aaron Hill.   Aaron refused to go outside and asked the people in the house to call his Mom but they did not do that!  18 yr. old Andrew Wheeler was then called into the house.  While Aaron was sitting on the floor, curled
up, with his hands trying to protect his head Andrew Wheeler proceeded to beat
Aaron while a friend videotaped the event on his phone.  The graphic, disturbing and horrifying video
was uploaded to Facebook and has since gone viral!  Andrew Wheeler kneed Aaron Hill repeatedly in
the face and head.  He pulled Aaron by his
hair to the center of the floor and while pulling his hair he repeatedly punched him in the back of the head and neck.  After getting up from the floor,Aaron stumbled outside where Wheeler proceeded to choke him until he passed
out.  Aaron woke up while being beaten by Wheeler as
others stood around in a circle and laughed. 
Wheeler held a knife to Aaron’s throat and told him he was going to kill
him, he also punched him and kicked him repeatedly.
